revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-26 13:50:17.000000000', 'message': 'docs: Add documentation for flavor extra specs

Now that we have a registry of all extra specs known by stock nova, we
can start documenting these. We choose the configuration guide to do
this since configuration of flavor extra specs is traditionally an
admin-only operation.

In a future change, we may wish to add support for cross-referencing
these options. This is a good start though, as-is.

Part of blueprint flavor-extra-spec-validators

Change-Id: I5ad6576e0d31a29822d1c7b47751ea81828630cf
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-03-02 10:12:28.000000000', 'message': 'docs: Add documentation for flavor extra specs

Now that we have a registry of all extra specs known by stock nova, we
can start documenting these. We choose the configuration guide to do
this since configuration of flavor extra specs is traditionally an

these options. This is a good start though, as-is.

Part of blueprint flavor-extra-spec-validators

commit_message:
docs: Add documentation for flavor extra specs

Now that we have a registry of all extra specs known by stock nova, we
can start documenting these. We choose the configuration guide to do
this since configuration of flavor extra specs is traditionally an
admin-only operation.

Part of blueprint flavor-extra-spec-validators

Change-Id: I5ad6576e0d31a29822d1c7b47751ea81828630cf
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

The consistent way of building container run arguments is processing
labels (possibly multiple) first.

Fix 'debug' actions 'run' and 'print-cmd' to not falling behind of that

commit_message:
Process labels before building container run args

The consistent way of building container run arguments is processing
labels (possibly multiple) first.

Fix 'debug' actions 'run' and 'print-cmd' to not falling behind of that
pattern already proved working well for containers 'apply'.

Change-Id: I771d086cc75695d7ce2db35c852bb35bb4c59708
Related-Bug: #1798362
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Octavia API service should stay as clean and constraint to itself as possible. With this patch, the service file gets very polluted with OVN provider driver-specific configurations. I think we should find an alternative way, otherwise we would be opening a precedent to other provider drivers to add their driver configurations to the Octavia API service.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-03-10 20:54:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Since the OVN provider driver is shipped separately from Octavia and none of the deployments to date are using it, shouldn't this be in it's own configuration separate from the base Octavia configuration?
We don't have any of the other third party driver configuration here."}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-03-10 21:54:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> Octavia API service should stay as clean and constraint to itself
 > as possible. With this patch, the service file gets very polluted
 > with OVN provider driver-specific configurations. I think we should
 > find an alternative way, otherwise we would be opening a precedent
 > to other provider drivers to add their driver configurations to the
 > Octavia API service.

I would like to pull beagles into this topic. My understanding is that doing what you are asking is not inline with thtr. BUT I could be wrong about that. Brent?'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2020-03-12 21:23:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(3 comments)

> Octavia API service should stay as clean and constraint to itself
 > as possible. With this patch, the service file gets very polluted
 > with OVN provider driver-specific configurations. I think we should
 > find an alternative way, otherwise we would be opening a precedent
 > to other provider drivers to add their driver configurations to the
 > Octavia API service.

I don't disagree with this in principle. Keeping in mind that we decided against defining the driver agent service in a separate template than the API because they require access to a shared socket and there isn't a way with the framework to define a constraint where service A must be on the same host as service B. But driver agent config and ovn provider agent configuration are orthogonal issues...

With that in mind, this means that as far as this patch is concerned the only thing that we can move out is the config_data which is probably a good change. However, I think we are stuck with the conditional inclusion of mounts etc because it's needed for the agent to have access to certs, etc.

*IF* we want to tackle creating a completely provider agnostic driver agent service definition, this is going to be a little more interesting - and there will have to be a template that at some points includes details of the providers so that things get mounted as needed. Begs the question - do have a use case for supporting third-party multiple providers at this time?"}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-03-13 01:25:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

[{'created': '2020-02-13 16:59:30.000000000', 'message': 'Support connecting Octavia API to OVN NB over TLS/SSL

This patch introduce parameters which support using TLS/SSL to
connect Octavia API to OVN_Northbound DB.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705728/
Change-Id: If199f6e2841f8c7bbfe1fb56538b0283ac04681c

commit_message:
Add Octavia OVN Provider configuration

This patch supports configuring the OVN provider and sets up a pattern
that will later be expanded on to support multiple provider drivers
without requiring modification of the core Octavia configuration.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711333/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705728/

Change-Id: If199f6e2841f8c7bbfe1fb56538b0283ac04681c
Related-Bug: #1861886

commit_message:
Properly place undercloud hosts record upgrade task

Undercloud record for hosts has to be in all the nodes that fetch
images from it. Proper location for this code is where we set up
podman. If it's only in ContainerImagesPrepare it runs on the
Controller role only.

Closes-Bug: #1871243

Change-Id: Id081f049bca6c961ad2ff649ac357cea8d552739
(cherry picked from commit fff8cf73c6a4d0e311b8b02036e7df928b998339)

commit_message:
Added scale_tasks to handle cleanup on scale down of nodes

scale_down tasks will be executed when a node is scaled down to
deregister the node with ipa and clean up the relevant subhosts and
services and revoke the issued certs.

Change-Id: Ib636dc528687dc67fae85c27a1571f51ae7332e7
(cherry picked from commit 3bb9cb3a623ae4c273bbd9c055939fed089359eb)

commit_message:
Use kolla tools for memcached configuration

This change updates the memcached service to leverage the kolla
configuration to configure and launch the memcached service. This is the
same pattern we use for the other services.

Related-Bug: #1871734
Change-Id: Ib0bfc3e9009357f0aed28c0a10b927c5ca2e53a7

subject: Exclude /var/lib/ironic/* from container-puppet.sh rsync
messages: [{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-08 20:19:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-04-08 20:28:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-09 02:10:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-09 11:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-09 11:53:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-08 20:19:18.000000000', 'message': "Exclude /var/lib/ironic/* from container-puppet.sh rsync

Exclude /var/lib/ironic/* from container-puppet.sh rsync, this is a
leftover from the initial containerization of TripleO; now we have
host prep tasks, the ironic conductor and inspector bind mount
/var/lib/ironic and generate the data that they need. But this data should
not be in the config volume or it can conflict from each other when rsync
runs at the same time.

TripleO upgrade tasks and host prep tasks will take care of removing
the var directory from the config volumes and the containers will just use
the bind mount, like it should be doing now.
These tasks will run during a minor update, major upgrade, and fast
forward upgrade.

Note: this will have to be backported to stable/train, and cleaned up
later after Ussuri as the tasks won't be needed anymore.

Root cause patches:
- I3a195466a5039e7641e843c11e5436440bfc5a01
- Ibcff99f03e6751fbf3197adefd5d344178b71fc2

Related-Bug: #1868934
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I69a1d1059bdfc0b99cf6a4a3dc78a1eb9a43ad0b
(cherry picked from commit b4ff60f0a8dc1e602a0e2f7a20c1d91ef0b2f07e)
"}, {'created': '2020-04-09 11:53:08.000000000', 'message': "Exclude /var/lib/ironic/* from container-puppet.sh rsync

TripleO upgrade tasks and host prep tasks will take care of removing
the var directory from the config volumes and the containers will just use
the bind mount, like it should be doing now.
These tasks will run during a minor update, major upgrade, and fast
forward upgrade.

Note: this will have to be backported to stable/train, and cleaned up
later after Ussuri as the tasks won't be needed anymore.

Root cause patches:
- I3a195466a5039e7641e843c11e5436440bfc5a01
- Ibcff99f03e6751fbf3197adefd5d344178b71fc2

Related-Bug: #1868934
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Exclude /var/lib/ironic/* from container-puppet.sh rsync

Exclude /var/lib/ironic/* from container-puppet.sh rsync, this is a
leftover from the initial containerization of TripleO; now we have
host prep tasks, the ironic conductor and inspector bind mount
/var/lib/ironic and generate the data that they need. But this data should
not be in the config volume or it can conflict from each other when rsync
runs at the same time.

TripleO upgrade tasks and host prep tasks will take care of removing
the var directory from the config volumes and the containers will just use
the bind mount, like it should be doing now.
These tasks will run during a minor update, major upgrade, and fast
forward upgrade.

Note: this will have to be backported to stable/train, and cleaned up

commit_message:
Create DNS entries in IPA for openstack services

This adds forward and reverse DNS records for all services.

Without the reverse DNS entries, certificates cannot be created
for etcd which requires a subject alternative name (SAN) entry
to be included. This is used by cinder for A/A support.

The task is delegated to tripleo-ipa. It uses the host_entry
which is also used for managing the entries in /etc/hosts.

Change-Id: I41681f90f70fa0dffe4abbe3d6d5c48015589f66
(cherry picked from commit fe3f38d3a9a6d8795dd7109930ce433dc4488df6)
Related-bug: #1869955
Related: rhbz#1804079

commit_message:
Enhance vnf package list command to support filtering of vnf packages

Added support for below arguments.

1)--filter
2)--all_fields
3)--fields
4)--exclude_fields
5)--exclude_default

Change-Id: I2bac92581bb4be3f138107d108ecf9b38605f5cc

[{'created': '2020-04-02 12:53:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add ssh timeout for baremetal_deploy

Mistakingly and historically
tripleo.baremetal_deploy.v1.deploy_instances used to pass its
timeout input into ansible connection timeout instead of
global/deployment timeout.

To pertain the established tradition for setting connection timeout to
some timeout, add missing input for ansible connection timeout and give
it some reasonable value.

The use of the timeout input to be passed into the real deployment
timeout parameter is fixed in the scope of the related bug.

Related-Bug: #1868063

Change-Id: I7d2fce9f07c98b1770c01cacbae2d17b8e143b3b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add ssh timeout for baremetal_deploy

Mistakingly and historically
tripleo.baremetal_deploy.v1.deploy_instances used to pass its
timeout input into ansible connection timeout instead of
global/deployment timeout.

To pertain the established tradition for setting connection timeout to
some timeout, add missing input for ansible connection timeout and give
it some reasonable value.

The use of the timeout input to be passed into the real deployment
timeout parameter is fixed in the scope of the related bug.

Related-Bug: #1868063

Change-Id: I7d2fce9f07c98b1770c01cacbae2d17b8e143b3b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

"}, {'created': '2020-01-30 13:14:37.000000000', 'message': "WIP: api: Add support for extra spec validation

WIP because there's a load more to do, including:

- Add missing documentation for validators
- Use dataclasses to describe extra spec parameters and values, rather
  than dicts
- Fix existing, now-broken tests and add new ones
- Wire up the API microversions and new parameter
- Add the stevedore-based loading mechanism
- Add documentation describing how to configure your own validators
- Add a release notes
- Triple check to see if we're missing an extra specs (!!!)

Part of blueprint flavor-extra-spec-validators

Change-Id: Ib64a1348cce1dca995746214616c4f33d9d664bd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
api: Add framework for extra spec validation

Add the validation framework necessary to verify extra specs along with
the definitions for every extra spec we currently recognize in-tree.
None of this is currently used since we don't have the API microversions
wired up, but that will come in a future patch.

Note that we must add the H238 hacking check to the ignore list here,
since this includes our first use of Python 3-type classes without the
explicit 'object' subclass. This can be removed when that check is
removed from hacking.

Part of blueprint flavor-extra-spec-validators

Change-Id: Ib64a1348cce1dca995746214616c4f33d9d664bd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

subject: Add support for nfv-orchestration service
messages:
[{'account_id': 29236, 'date': '2019-08-09 12:12:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29236, 'date': '2019-08-10 06:16:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29236, 'date': '2019-08-10 09:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-08-10 13:09:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(17 comments)

Thanks for working on this - left a bunch of comments, but I'm interested in seeing this.

We should also add a functional test job that actually configures tacker, so that the functional tests run. Oh - and you should put a self.require_service('nfv-orchestration') in the top of the functional setUp - and add a mention in openstack/tests/functional/cloud/test_devstack.py so we can properly fail in the tacker job if we don't wind up with a tacker."}, {'account_id': 29236, 'date': '2019-08-14 15:06:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 29236, 'date': '2019-08-14 16:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(17 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25701, 'date': '2020-04-10 06:21:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi, could I confirm the status of this patch because it seems no update for several months? Is there still some TODO remained, or going to be abandoned?'}, {'account_id': 29236, 'date': '2020-04-10 06:55:41.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This Change is not required now, as all tacker cli commands are developed using python-tackerclient's osc plugin."}]

[{'created': '2019-08-09 12:12:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for nfv-orchestration service

Added support for nfv-orchestration service and implemented create,
show, list, delete and upload vnf package APIs, also added unit and
functional test cases.

commit_message:
Add support for nfv-orchestration service

Added support for nfv-orchestration service and implemented create,
show, list, delete and upload vnf package APIs, also added unit and
functional test cases.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675600

Change-Id: I1e537d9833195e67bc120df717ceb0af6e9f41fd
Implements: bp tosca-csar-mgmt-driver

commit_message:
Correct server shelve policy check_str

server shelve API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1]
but API is allowed (which is expected) for everyone.

This is because API does not pass the project_id in policy
target so that oslo policy can decide the ownership[2]. If no
target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which
is nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone try to access)
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

Passing the server project_id as target to make it admin_or_owner.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e4ac401d1a9d5fba24bc22141b362a5400d9d096/nova/api/openstack/compute/shelve.py#L89
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e4ac401d1a9d5fba24bc22141b362a5400d9d096/nova/policies/shelve.py#L37
Closes-bug: #1870881

Change-Id: I493062ed0ee632a9c647cf1f3cf497eebc39c4ca

(cherry picked from commit 72a5b5b61f532bba6de502feda36dfc7d36cefc7)
"}, {'created': '2020-04-02 07:28:20.000000000', 'message': "Fix return correct cache when reusing port

The patch fixes issue when the same port is requested for multiple
instances and second one can't get metadata due to cached instance_id.

commit_message:
Fix return correct cache when reusing port

The patch fixes issue when the same port is requested for multiple
instances and second one can't get metadata due to cached instance_id.

Closes-Bug: 1868867

Conflicts:
    neutron/common/cache_utils.py

Change-Id: If6a5866e4406c9c6c30e989c79ffb4ee1a88cecf
(cherry picked from commit 72a5b5b61f532bba6de502feda36dfc7d36cefc7)

commit_message:
Remove Floating IP DNS record upon associated port deletion

Port deletion triggers disassociate_floatingips. This patch ensures
that method not only clears the port association for a Floating IP,
but also removes any DNS record associated with it.

Change-Id: Ia6202610c09811f240af35e2523126447bf02ca5
Closes-Bug: #1812168
(cherry picked from commit 4379310846078c45df140071688f740cd900c1d6)
(cherry picked from commit 9def99f3d20df5253bafba24bd1ca2ea9c99a032)

commit_message:
Configure keepalived interfaces according to config file

"keepalived" process stops running if it does not find any of the
tracked interfaces correctly configured. To prevent this in
"KeepalivedManagerTestCase" test cases, "eth0" is set up and an IP
address is assigned.

Change-Id: Ibd4ef7b0db5b6830383fffcac685b9c709aae350
Closes-Bug: #1845150
Related-Bug: #1830232
(cherry picked from commit d8eb42f1eaaa3747691cbb91db49292c66732073)
(cherry picked from commit eb1d0313d0dddb5e93f4d91ae28390946edab149)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-02 23:37:05.000000000', 'message': 'Neutron ovs agent: Removing SmartNIC OVS representor port on instance tear down and resync

The current flow where a port is unbound from an agent running on
smartnic was not implemented causing representor ports to remain
connected to the integration bridge.
This change solves this issue in two cases:
  * When deleting the instance and so deleting SmartNic port,
    it will remove the unbound ports from integration bridge
  * When resync SmartNic ports on Neutron OVS agent restart,
    it will remove the port from integration bridge not mapped to
    neutron SmartNic ports.

Closes-Bug: #1855260
Change-Id: I7077577cca54329fbcb77fbde730389835ab6497
(cherry picked from commit 512d8abb4b063bbfcdb0711b18e0157b668617f6)
'}, {'created': '2020-04-06 10:46:20.000000000', 'message': 'Neutron ovs agent: Removing SmartNIC OVS representor port on instance tear down and resync

The current flow where a port is unbound from an agent running on

This change solves this issue in two cases:
  * When deleting the instance and so deleting SmartNic port,
    it will remove the unbound ports from integration bridge
  * When resync SmartNic ports on Neutron OVS agent restart,

Closes-Bug: #1855260
Change-Id: I7077577cca54329fbcb77fbde730389835ab6497

'}]
commit_message:
Neutron ovs agent: Removing SmartNIC OVS representor port on instance tear down and resync

The current flow where a port is unbound from an agent running on
smartnic was not implemented causing representor ports to remain
connected to the integration bridge.
This change solves this issue in two cases:
  * When deleting the instance and so deleting SmartNic port,
    it will remove the unbound ports from integration bridge
  * When resync SmartNic ports on Neutron OVS agent restart,
    it will remove the port from integration bridge not mapped to
    neutron SmartNic ports.

Closes-Bug: #1855260
Change-Id: I7077577cca54329fbcb77fbde730389835ab6497
(cherry picked from commit 512d8abb4b063bbfcdb0711b18e0157b668617f6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-06 11:46:16.000000000', 'message': 'Do not link up HA router gateway in backup node

L3 router will set its devices link up by default.
For HA routers, the gateway device will be pluged
in all scheduled hosts. When the gateway deivce is
up in backup node, it will send out IPv6 related
packets (MLDv2) according to some kernal config.
This will cause the physical fabric think that the
gateway MAC is now working in the backup node. And
finally the master node L3 traffic will be broken.

This patch sets the backup gateway device link down
by default. When the VRRP sets the master state in
one host, the L3 agent state change procedure will
do link up action for the gateway device.

Closes-Bug: #1859832
Change-Id: I8dca2c1a2f8cb467cfb44420f0eea54ca0932b05
(cherry picked from commit c52029c39aa824a67095fbbf9e59eff769d92587)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not link up HA router gateway in backup node

L3 router will set its devices link up by default.
For HA routers, the gateway device will be pluged
in all scheduled hosts. When the gateway deivce is
up in backup node, it will send out IPv6 related
packets (MLDv2) according to some kernal config.
This will cause the physical fabric think that the
gateway MAC is now working in the backup node. And
finally the master node L3 traffic will be broken.

This patch sets the backup gateway device link down
by default. When the VRRP sets the master state in
one host, the L3 agent state change procedure will
do link up action for the gateway device.

Closes-Bug: #1859832
Change-Id: I8dca2c1a2f8cb467cfb44420f0eea54ca0932b05
(cherry picked from commit c52029c39aa824a67095fbbf9e59eff769d92587)

commit_message:
Make 'server list --config-drive' a boolean option

Instead of passing through whatever the user provides and exposing this
bug in the REST API, simply make the opt a boolean one in expectation of
a day where the API issues have been resolved.

This also introduces machinery necessary to use more of these types of
opts in the future.

Change-Id: I9033540ac65ac0ee7337f16bdd002060652092ea
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

(2 comments)

Procedural -2 pending blueprint approval.

Was this discussed at the PTG or on the mailing list? If so, it would be nice to have some background (in the blueprint/spec).

Code-wise, you'll need to show some kind of testing. For example, prove that I still can't retrieve instances that aren't mine by searching on AZ.

Also I think this will probably need a microversion. That question will need to be addressed in the blueprint; and if the answer is yes, there will need to be a spec, per The Rules [1][2]. Suggest adding this to the agenda for tomorrow's meeting [3] under "Open discussion".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/contributor/blueprints.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/contributor/process.html#when-do-i-need-a-blueprint-vs-a-spec

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-08 20:29:40.000000000', 'message': 'Non-admin user can filter their instances by AZs

Allow non-admin user to use ``availability_zone`` filter key when
listing instances.

Currently only admin users are able to filter instances per AZ,
and the only way to allow it is to edit the nova policy
os_compute_api:servers:allow_all_filters, which can be really painful
to maintain during upgrades.

As AZ are an input parameter at VM creation available to any user
and it is an important notion for cloud usage, it should be easy for
anyone to filter resources on it.

Implements non-admin-filter-instance-by-az

Change-Id: Ia66d3a1ceb74ed521cf44922929b2a502f3ee935
'}, {'created': '2020-01-08 20:30:43.000000000', 'message': 'Non-admin user can filter their instances by AZs

Implements: non-admin-filter-instance-by-az

Change-Id: Ia66d3a1ceb74ed521cf44922929b2a502f3ee935

Change-Id: Ia66d3a1ceb74ed521cf44922929b2a502f3ee935
'}, {'created': '2020-01-11 14:24:44.000000000', 'message': 'Non-admin user can filter their instances by AZs

Microversion bump to allow non-admin user to use
``availability_zone`` filter key when listing instances.

Currently only admin users are able to filter instances per AZ,
and the only way to allow it is to edit the nova policy
os_compute_api:servers:allow_all_filters, which can be really painful
to maintain during upgrades.

As AZ are an input parameter at VM creation available to any user
and it is an important notion for cloud usage, it should be easy for
anyone to filter resources on it without policy change.

Implements: blueprint non-admin-filter-instance-by-az

Change-Id: Ia66d3a1ceb74ed521cf44922929b2a502f3ee935
'}, {'created': '2020-02-03 20:10:25.000000000', 'message': 'Non-Admin user can filter their instances by more filters

Microversion bump to allow non-admin user to use more filters key
when listing instances.

In order to stay coherent, all existing instance filters who are
related to a field readable by default to non admin users when showing
instance details, should be allowed by default without policy
modification.

Implements: blueprint non-admin-filter-instance-by-az

Change-Id: Ia66d3a1ceb74ed521cf44922929b2a502f3ee935
'}, {'created': '2020-02-03 20:13:45.000000000', 'message': 'Non-Admin user can filter their instances by more filters

Implements: blueprint non-admin-filter-instance-by-az

commit_message:
Non-Admin user can filter their instances by more filters

Microversion bump to allow non-admin user to use more filters key
when listing instances.

In order to stay coherent, all existing instance filters who are
related to a field readable by default to non admin users when showing
instance details, should be allowed by default without policy
modification.

Implements: blueprint non-admin-filter-instance-by-az

Change-Id: Ia66d3a1ceb74ed521cf44922929b2a502f3ee935

commit_message:
Fix incorrect update in zuul configuration

This patch fixes incorrect update in the prevous change[1] to remove
all branches filter.
The following points are covered by this patch.
 - latest unit tests should be no-vonting
 - some jobs still have branches filter.

[1] fbfcc8a0fc52d680b4208bce6de5ee34acebf780

Change-Id: Ifbad7787a54b3508e778b30d8d6d1f5cc9dc06db

Initially I thought of supporting the py3.5 in Tempest and plugin master but due to dependencies like oslo it is not possible. We have already pinned Tempest for rocky (py3.5) for same reason.

We do not need to support py3.5 on master and use ld version of Tempest & plugins for testing on py3.5 env.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-05 18:52:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Update requirements
- Remove wheel and setup-hooks from setup.cfg

Change-Id: Id4817c9b25e77000acdebe2a116a32b77b33d24a

commit_message:
Change default ram value

We will be using 2048 for default ram since most of the jobs are using
dib. Jobs with tinyipa will be set to 384 ram.

Change-Id: Idc28812515a0f45e9e29b55cd81ef26a02ce8740

commit_message:
Finish v2 API doc

Add device, deployable implemented V2 api documentation.

Remove deployable-create-resp.json, deployable-patch-curl.json
deployable-post-curl.json, because
these APIs are removed in V2.

Remove deployable-update-resp.json because this API is still work
in progress, we will update this part of documentation after the
API implementation done.

Change-Id: I45549fc5276c091ca585652b11836b967cb239e3

commit_message:
Release python-octaviaclient 2.0.1 for ussuri

This patch proposes the Ussuri release of python-octaviaclient.

It adds TLS cipher support, amphora stats, and amphora --long.

Change-Id: I6702f1cb82213687a0af664eb2263763302e1a91
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Bump openstacksdk>=0.46.0

We removed python2 support in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717521/,
but we are missing openstacksdk in reqirements, so when we using
python3, that will be raise "ModuleNotFoundError: No module named
'openstack'".

This commit add the openstacksdk>=0.46.0 to Cyborg to support python3.

Change-Id: I4d015b3723fb13c361cefe5eee6607f9cbe8f65d
Story: 2007533

Fix problems found.

commit_message:
Release final python-cyborgclient for ussuri

Final ussuri client lib release for the April 9 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: I59860e37e5b9428e323c40755fa1be6d52430038

(4 comments)

Thanks Lee, Andrey.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2020-03-17 15:43:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

`volume-patch` is the wrong resource/verb here. You're not updating the volume, you're updating the volume attachment resource. So I'd call this something like `nova volume-attachment-update` since we have a `nova volume-attachments` CLI to list volume attachments.

Alternatively we already have a `nova volume-update` CLI which is the command interface to the swap volume API, which is what you've updated on the server side correct? So it might make sense to update that CLI to allow passing in the --delete-on-termination boolean flag.

Either way, I think `volume-patch` is just confusing."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2020-03-17 16:12:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2020-03-17 16:15:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> `volume-patch` is the wrong resource/verb here. You're not updating
 > the volume, you're updating the volume attachment resource. So I'd
 > call this something like `nova volume-attachment-update` since we
 > have a `nova volume-attachments` CLI to list volume attachments.
 > 
 > Alternatively we already have a `nova volume-update` CLI which is
 > the command interface to the swap volume API, which is what you've
 > updated on the server side correct? So it might make sense to
 > update that CLI to allow passing in the --delete-on-termination
 > boolean flag.
 > 
 > Either way, I think `volume-patch` is just confusing.

Thanks mriedem, I would like to use `nova volume-attachment-update`, add --delete-on-termination to the volume-update CLI looks not easy to unsderstand, because of the update volume api doesnot have any changes , if I add microversion 2.83 to it, that also confused."}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2020-03-17 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-12 10:53:22.000000000', 'message': "WIP Microversion 2.83: Add volume-patch CLI

This commit add a new CLI
``nova volume-patch <server> <dest_volid> <delete_on_termination>``
to re-config 'delete_on_termination' for an attached volume, that
admin or the operator can decide whether to delete attached volumes
when destroying the server.

Change-Id: I1fc64fb6e6611c92c6b72265e1bf4b32e9c45f0a
Blueprint: destroy-instance-with-datavolume
"}, {'created': '2020-03-12 13:33:06.000000000', 'message': "Microversion 2.83: Add volume-patch CLI

This commit add a new CLI
``nova volume-patch <server> <dest_volid> <delete_on_termination>``
to re-config 'delete_on_termination' for an attached volume, that
the user can decide whether to delete attached volumes
when destroying the server.

commit_message:
Microversion 2.85: Change volume-update CLI

This commit add a new CLI
``nova volume-update [--[no-]delete-on-termination]
<server> <src_volume> <dest_volume>`` to update
'delete_on_termination' for an attached volume, that the user can
decide whether to delete attached volumes when destroying the server.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711194/

Change-Id: I1fc64fb6e6611c92c6b72265e1bf4b32e9c45f0a
Blueprint: destroy-instance-with-datavolume

commit_message:
Revert "Introduce job for granular GitHub mirroring"

Unsafe, as pointed out on the ML. We should rework and resubmit
following the suggestions there:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014038.html

This reverts commit 341dccfb5d9279a9f87ac05450c34dc2368b4132.

Change-Id: If0f0fdaa3ab21bc9ded13a273b7ebe35a38f4fce

commit_message:
fix: Open udp port 53 on master to support CoreDNS

In Icc4aa1f61f3b3937e5d9cc35dbe01c63c18ba3cd, we only opened tcp port 53
but services running on workers are unable to talk to CoreDNS service
running on master nodes when using Calico v3.13.1 without also opening
udp port 53. This patch addresses this issue.

Task: 39347
Story: 2007256

Change-Id: Ied4196e6f1ddcb131492b48fb57ff0ba9063bbf4

commit_message:
Add expiring user group memberships on mapped authentication

When a federated user authenticates, they are added to their
mapped groups during shadowing.

Closes-Bug: 1809116

Change-Id: I19dc400b2a7aa46709b242cdeef82beaca975ff3

new attribute 'expires' when listing user groups. This patch
updates the test to check the attribute and then ignore it for
group dict comparison.

This patch updates the test to check the attribute and then
ignore it for group dict comparison.

Change-Id: I4294a879071dde07e5eb1da4df133de8032e1059
Partial-Bug: 1809116
"}]
commit_message:
Keystone - List user groups 'membership_expires_at' attribute

With the introduction of expiring group memberships, there is a
new attribute `membership_expires_at` when listing user groups.
This patch updates the test to check the attribute and then
ignore it for group dict comparison.

Change-Id: I4294a879071dde07e5eb1da4df133de8032e1059
Partial-Bug: 1809116

commit_message:
Expiring Group Membership Driver - Add, List Groups

Modify the base driver and SQL driver to support expiring group
memberships.

Additions to the SQL Driver to support listing expiring groups
for user.

Change-Id: I7d52cd2003f511483619a429de57201df4990209
Partial-Bug: 1809116
Depends-On: I4294a879071dde07e5eb1da4df133de8032e1059

let's add all three modes that selinux config supports."}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-17 09:57:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Thanks for the review.

FYI I haven't successfully managed to launch a FCOS cluster when selinux is disabled yet... The heat-container-agent does not manage to run to completion because the machine restarts after these actions:

```
START: write-heat-params
Writing File: /etc/sysconfig/heat-params
END: write-heat-params
START: install cri
+ ssh_cmd='ssh -F /srv/magnum/.ssh/config root@localhost'
+ '[' host-docker = containerd ']'
+ ssh -F /srv/magnum/.ssh/config root@localhost systemctl disable docker
+ ssh -F /srv/magnum/.ssh/config root@localhost cat /usr/lib/systemd/system/docker.service
+ grep native.cgroupdriver
          --exec-opt native.cgroupdriver=systemd \
+ ssh -F /srv/magnum/.ssh/config root@localhost cp /usr/lib/systemd/system/docker.service /etc/systemd/system/
+ sed -i 's/\(native.cgroupdriver=\)\w\+/\1cgroupfs/' /etc/systemd/system/docker.service
+ ssh -F /srv/magnum/.ssh/config root@localhost systemctl daemon-reload
```

At the moment I am not sure how the reboot is triggered. I wonder if this is an artifact of disabling selinux?"}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-03-17 10:02:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Fedora Atomic default: permissive
Fedora CoreOS default: enforcing

make use of in-tree/out-of-tree Cinder persistent volumes. For details,
see https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2007413.

Task: 39033

commit_message:
Add selinux_mode label

Fedora Atomic default: permissive
Fedora CoreOS default: enforcing

Story: 2007413
Task: 39033

Change-Id: Ibc1e02098155ac95bb35fcea5f21cc380bdf0d03
Signed-off-by: Bharat Kunwar <brtknr@bath.edu>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-07 03:26:38.000000000', 'message': 'Add new config to enforce the new defaults

When policy change their default check_str and not override by
operator then old defaults check_str are added with OrCheck to the
new default check_str so that old defaults keep working.

If operators want to enforce the new defaults with no old defaults then
they have to overwrite the policy rule in poicy file with new default
value. This is not expected and very painful for them especially when
all policies are switching to new defaults. For example:
- https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:bp/policy-defaults-refresh+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

This commit adds a new config options to control the new defaults enforcement.
If True then old defaults will not be supported and also no warning will
be logged.

New config option is default to False so no change in behaviour for old users.

Change-Id: I3c2c889af25b723f1eedbe6167d614c6a4bc6cd2
'}, {'created': '2020-04-07 17:44:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add new config to enforce the new defaults

When policy change their default check_str and not override by
operator then old defaults check_str are added with OrCheck to the
new default check_str so that old defaults keep working.

If operators want to enforce the new defaults with no old defaults then
they have to overwrite the policy rule in poicy file with new default
value. This is not expected and very painful for them especially when
all policies are switching to new defaults. For example:
- https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:bp/policy-defaults-refresh+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

This commit adds a new config options to control the new defaults enforcement.
If True then old defaults will not be supported and also no warning will
be logged.

New config option is default to False so no change in behaviour for old users.

Change-Id: I3c2c889af25b723f1eedbe6167d614c6a4bc6cd2
'}]
commit_message:
Add new config to enforce the new defaults

When policy change their default check_str and not override by
operator then old defaults check_str are added with OrCheck to the
new default check_str so that old defaults keep working.

If operators want to enforce the new defaults with no old defaults then
they have to overwrite the policy rule in poicy file with new default
value. This is not expected and very painful for them especially when
all policies are switching to new defaults. For example:
- https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:bp/policy-defaults-refresh+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

This commit adds a new config options to control the new defaults enforcement.
If True then old defaults will not be supported and also no warning will
be logged.

New config option is default to False so no change in behaviour for old users.

Change-Id: I3c2c889af25b723f1eedbe6167d614c6a4bc6cd2

commit_message:
Replace removed ironic api_endpoint by endpoint_override

Deprecate api_endpoint in nova::ironic::common because its actual
parameter, [ironic]api_endpioint, was already removed from nova
in Train release[1].
Also, add new nova::ironic::common::endpoint_override parameter to
allow operators to override endpoint to be used in acceess to ironic.

[1] I527f512b371705b490ba55dfab101340d417edb6
Change-Id: I838240f7138adcbf619ce12ac616f0bc517570dd

commit_message:
Expose enable_isolated_aggregate_filtering parameter

Add support for configuring scheduler parameter option
`enable_isolated_aggregate_filtering` which allows the
scheduler to restrict hosts in aggregates based on matching
required traits in the aggregate metadata and the instance
flavor/image.

Change-Id: Iefb7e8a4d867b8721cdb5b00c2f71b2dd3a492c0

Got a grenade-py3 job failure last run by Depends-On a change to devstack stable/train instead of master, based on advice from clarkb in #openstack-infra yesterday and the config settings were correctly propagated to nova.conf:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/833a46b05c9641b9b22b3ee7f394e80b

Unfortunately though, looking in the n-sch log I don't see any useful debug database-related logging. There is debug logging in the log so the settings worked to enable it, but what I see among it isn't indicating to me what caused the timeouts when trying to talk to cell databases.

Looking at the mysql error log:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/833a46b05c9641b9b22b3ee7f394e80b/log/logs/mysql/error.txt.gz

I see lots of errors that I think must be why we get the cell timeouts:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/788349

I note that all services are getting the same error, not just nova. Includes cinder, neutron, placement, glance, keystone, and nova.

I don't know how to find out more about what is causing the mysql errors."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-01-13 19:31:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

will be used to repin all ovs-vswitchd threads.
Leaving this parameter blank (and as a consequence, not setting
'dpdk-lcore-mask') allows all non-dpdk threads to float on the original

commit_message:
'tripleo_ovs_dpdk_lcore_list' should be optional

This parameter should be optional as only the first core in the mask
will be used to repin all ovs-vswitchd threads.
Leaving this parameter blank (and as a consequence, not setting
'dpdk-lcore-mask') allows all non-dpdk threads to float on the original
cpu set.

Change-Id: Ia9e001e2b1987f00a960cdf106eaa8e84dc4d71a
Signed-off-by: Christophe Fontaine <cfontain@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 71eb4ba2fa730166391c76321ee2b1aa8e73fa21)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

I5377cd516f85b538e89761e3e3b8966d62ae50cd dropped the py27 job, but it
did not clean up the package metadata noted in the goal.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I7a8dec1e15177e801ed65ed02010bf6b169de000
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

This patch introduced the following 2 parameters into
glance::backend::multistore::cinder class, so that operators can define
multipath usage in volume connection by puppet parameter.

 - cinder_enforce_multipath
 - cinder_use_multipath

Change-Id: I17af43fe8cdf437c90453d316b66c3ea9d4f2745
'}]
commit_message:
Add parameters for multipath connection in cinder backend

This patch introduced the following 2 parameters into
glance::backend::multistore::cinder class, so that operators can define
multipath usage in volume connection by puppet parameter.

 - cinder_enforce_multipath
 - cinder_use_multipath

Change-Id: I17af43fe8cdf437c90453d316b66c3ea9d4f2745

commit_message:
Update the python manila client api version

This patch updates the python manila client
api version in order to consider the changes
implemented in the view of shares and share
replicas. A new field called ``progress`` was
added and will show the progress of the
create share from snapshot operation.

Partially-implements: bp create-share-from-snapshot-in-another-pool-or-backend

Depends-On: Iab13a0961eb4a387a502246e5d4b79bc9046e04b

Change-Id: Id73f6facca03e8490846b68c404593f16e95f8bd

commit_message:
Drop removed parameters from loca_settings.py template

The following parmaeters were already removed from horizon,
so we can remove the from the teamplte file.
 - FLAVOR_EXTRA_KEYS[1]
 - SAHARA_AUTO_IP_ALLOCATION_ENABLED[2]
 - OPENSTACK_TOKEN_HASH_ALGORITHM[3]
 - OPENSTACK_TOKEN_HASH_ENABLED[4]

[1] 5101ebdc2814fc80c63419eee85291d8340fd078
[2] 0659f9a98a2f175847c7acb005ac8126d03059bc
[3] 069329eeb220f6fd49670894e4d45a1e3ec59c4f
[4] 71993e3c983b113ce5672fd1291e6a1200fd5a7b

Change-Id: Ie1c4fdfc5f95ce3103beea311223ec78597a38ec

commit_message:
Expect python3 package in CentOS8 and Fedora

In CentOS 8.x and Fedora, we expect to have python3 package, while we
expect to have python2 in 7.x .
Fix unit tests to expect the correct version according to os major
version.

Change-Id: I298706690ee73db76678653841514de120c61e27

commit_message:
Remove all branches filter in zuul configuration

... to avoid conflict between stable branches, because adding branches
make that job definition global one instead of branch specific one[1].

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul/reference/job_def.html#attr-job.branches

Closes-Bug: #1871866
Change-Id: Ifb1910cafc799ad453252defd21c83deda939efc

make that job definition global one instead of branch specific one[1].

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul/reference/job_def.html#attr-job.branches

Closes-Bug: #1871866
Change-Id: Ib5a2c782ce43d35271192710ecc9aacec7bd3b63

[{'created': '2020-04-06 10:10:08.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Bump up transaction timeout for functional tests

On heavy loaded environments, like Neutron gates, we can
observe sporadic failures of functional tests, that are
timeouts.

Lets increase the timeout value to 15 seconds for functional
tests because looks like 5 seconds is not enought.

commit_message:
[OVN] Bump up transaction timeout for functional tests

On heavy loaded environments, like Neutron gates, we can
observe sporadic failures of functional tests, that are
timeouts.

Lets increase the timeout value to 15 seconds for functional
tests because looks like 5 seconds is not enought.

Change-Id: I327de751e3ba26c5be03b2571b105492661999cb
Closes-Bug: 1868110

commit_message:
Use constraints for installing doc requirements

The docs and related tox targets were installing requirements
unconstrained. This adds enforcement of upper constraints.

Change-Id: I17f67c33088c2fe18a6e4b1951258b358c778a93
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
xstatic packages: first release via the releases repo

This commit releases the following xstatic packages which did not
use the releases repo in past releases. Corresponding deliverable
files are newly added.

- xstatic-bootstrap-datepicker
- xstatic-hogan
- xstatic-jquery-migrate
- xstatic-jquery.quicksearch
- xstatic-jquery.tablesorter
- xstatic-rickshaw
- xstatic-spin

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-February/012892.html

Change-Id: Ib58d07f9db78a1f0c52af77397acac01fb349395

commit_message:
Release final python-watcherclient for ussuri

Final ussuri client lib release for the April 9 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: Iba00adcca12d0e459db72e04eef87d9fa07aacd5
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Release final python-ironicclient for ussuri

Final ussuri client lib release for the April 9 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: I083c9ff1bef0b3178ba17046745579e3bedb90a6
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Release final python-solumclient for ussuri

Final ussuri client lib release for the April 9 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: Ib0e935d7f2b484b5808ba385159661d0a9d6f78c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Build Started http://10.24.20.18:30081/job/OSH/job/openstack/job/openstack-helm/job/basic/1091/'}, {'account_id': 26441, 'date': '2017-09-21 16:59:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Just a brief description of what I'm aiming for here: we want to be able to specify devices in a stable way, so scsi IDs are the obvious choice.  However, they're probably not perfect for everyone, so i'd still like to at least permit the possibility of specifying /dev entries directly.  Also, a complication with specifying scsi IDs is that there's no straightforward way to specify a partition, something we really must do for journals (as you rarely want to use an entire device for the journal).  This change attempts to split the difference by allowing flexibility in how OSDs and journals are specified.  See values.yaml for examples."}, {'account_id': 26201, 'date': '2017-09-21 17:07:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Flexible Device Specification for OSDs and Journals

Allow OSD devices and journals to be specified as either paths
into /dev or hardware locations of the form scsi@b:x.y.z

For journals, allow a partition to be specified independent
of the device name so that multiple journals can be placed on
a device even when named by SCSI ID.

Change-Id: Ieb42aaa1e3640ce3b0fcb83a5b1acca2868ceeea

[{'created': '2020-03-02 06:27:54.000000000', 'message': 'Use config for layers

Podman keeps a copy of the metadata around in the local container
storage however this may not actually represent the actual layers being
used in the storage. Instead of using the manifest file as the source of
truth for the container layers, we need to look into the container image
config for the layer ids for the local storage. This change adds a
function to swap out the layer metadata with layer information from the
image config if available. If ultimately we cannot find the layers we
throw an exception indicating that it is not found.

Closes-Bug: #1864660
Change-Id: Iec115bfa1ef00112705785a5b3e6ed7dc222070e

commit_message:
Use config for layers

Podman keeps a copy of the metadata around in the local container
storage however this may not actually represent the actual layers being
used in the storage. Instead of using the manifest file as the source of
truth for the container layers, we need to look into the container image
config for the layer ids for the local storage. This change adds a
function to swap out the layer metadata with layer information from the
image config if available. If ultimately we cannot find the layers we
throw an exception indicating that it is not found.

NOTE: This includes a py35 specific workaround for the tests because
json.dumps() can have a random ordering in dicts.

Closes-Bug: #1864660
Change-Id: Iec115bfa1ef00112705785a5b3e6ed7dc222070e
(cherry picked from commit 2950738526d7b93553102ceb77717d31c445caa2)
(cherry picked from commit 89a7df07a2b555de9163f699d12661b185b4a920)

commit_message:
Add collectd-pmu package for Intel PMU (C8 only)

The intel_pmu plugin collects performance counters data
on Intel CPUs using Linux perf interface.

commit_message:
Exclude pcie_errors on s390x, it fails to build

The collectd pcie-errors plugin fails to build on s390 on
big endian, ppc64le is fine. For those building containers
on s390x, this patch removes a downstream patch.

Change-Id: I71008f690fcb04289451efa819b5e7f6d81cf99f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-24 14:19:00.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Add support for external ports

This patch is adding support for a new port type called "external" in
core OVN.

Prior to this work, when a VM had a SR-IOV port attached to it, OVN itself
wasn't able to reply to things such as DHCP requests packets since the
OVS port was skipped. Core OVN then introduced the concept of "external"
ports which are ports deployed on a different node than the one that the
VM is running and is able to reply to such requests on behalf of the VM.

With this patch, when a port with the VNIC type "direct" and no
"switchdev" capability is created, ovn driver will then create a
logical port with the type "external" for it and add it to a default
HA Chassis Group. The port will then get bound to the "master" (higher
priority) chassis of that group.

Please note that, as a first step, this patch is creating only one HA
Chassis Group which *all* external ports will belong to. That means that
all external ports will be *scheduled onto the same node* (but it's
HA nevertheless). In the future we should enhance this behavior.

(cherry-pick from neutron Ic6c4bb6c584682169f3ebd73105a847b05dddc76)

Change-Id: Id8775a0563e33f1878b49a1e797a6912c41caa8f
Closes-Bug: #1841154
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-02-24 14:51:59.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Add support for external ports

This patch is adding support for a new port type called "external" in
core OVN.

Prior to this work, when a VM had a SR-IOV port attached to it, OVN itself
wasn't able to reply to things such as DHCP requests packets since the
OVS port was skipped. Core OVN then introduced the concept of "external"
ports which are ports deployed on a different node than the one that the
VM is running and is able to reply to such requests on behalf of the VM.

With this patch, when a port with the VNIC type "direct" and no
"switchdev" capability is created, ovn driver will then create a
logical port with the type "external" for it and add it to a default
HA Chassis Group. The port will then get bound to the "master" (higher
priority) chassis of that group.

Please note that, as a first step, this patch is creating only one HA
Chassis Group which *all* external ports will belong to. That means that
all external ports will be *scheduled onto the same node* (but it's
HA nevertheless). In the future we should enhance this behavior.

(cherry-pick from neutron Ic6c4bb6c584682169f3ebd73105a847b05dddc76)

This patch also includes a fix for the handle_ha_chassis_group_changes()

'}, {'created': '2020-04-09 08:23:39.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Add support for external ports

This patch is adding support for a new port type called "external" in
core OVN.

Prior to this work, when a VM had a SR-IOV port attached to it, OVN itself
wasn't able to reply to things such as DHCP requests packets since the
OVS port was skipped. Core OVN then introduced the concept of "external"
ports which are ports deployed on a different node than the one that the
VM is running and is able to reply to such requests on behalf of the VM.

With this patch, when a port with the VNIC type "direct" and no
"switchdev" capability is created, ovn driver will then create a
logical port with the type "external" for it and add it to a default
HA Chassis Group. The port will then get bound to the "master" (higher
priority) chassis of that group.

Please note that, as a first step, this patch is creating only one HA
Chassis Group which *all* external ports will belong to. That means that
all external ports will be *scheduled onto the same node* (but it's
HA nevertheless). In the future we should enhance this behavior.

This patch also includes a fix for the handle_ha_chassis_group_changes()
method that can be found at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715445.

commit_message:
[OVN] Add support for external ports

This patch is adding support for a new port type called "external" in
core OVN.

Prior to this work, when a VM had a SR-IOV port attached to it, OVN itself
wasn't able to reply to things such as DHCP requests packets since the
OVS port was skipped. Core OVN then introduced the concept of "external"
ports which are ports deployed on a different node than the one that the
VM is running and is able to reply to such requests on behalf of the VM.

With this patch, when a port with the VNIC type "direct" and no
"switchdev" capability is created, ovn driver will then create a
logical port with the type "external" for it and add it to a default
HA Chassis Group. The port will then get bound to the "master" (higher
priority) chassis of that group.

Please note that, as a first step, this patch is creating only one HA
Chassis Group which *all* external ports will belong to. That means that
all external ports will be *scheduled onto the same node* (but it's
HA nevertheless). In the future we should enhance this behavior.

(cherry-pick from neutron Ic6c4bb6c584682169f3ebd73105a847b05dddc76)

This patch also includes a fix for the handle_ha_chassis_group_changes()
method that can be found at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715445.

Change-Id: Id8775a0563e33f1878b49a1e797a6912c41caa8f
Closes-Bug: #1841154
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Added node multitenancy doc

Adds documentation surrounding the use of multi-tenancy. The
documentation explains possible updates to the policy file
to expose node APIs to a non-admin.

Change-Id: Ib1c327156acee8d34be74dd15c3d4003f7ef31df

commit_message:
Add --long to amphora-list to show more columns

Often when looking at lists of amphorae, I really need to quickly browse
them based on image/zone/compute_id, and this makes it much easier and
fewer API-roundtrips to get that data. The API already returns it, we
can just show it (optionally)!

Change-Id: I229392b5b324e92909ea417696a3652492274613

commit_message:
Perform host configuration during upgrade

This is a follow up to I001defc75d1f1e6caa9b1e11246abc6ce17c775b. To
maintain previous behaviour, and ensure we catch any host configuration
changes, we should perform host configuration during upgrade.

Change-Id: I79fcbf1efb02b7187406d3c3fccea6f200bcea69
Related-Bug: #1860161

A previous patch added an ignore for the modules documentation
that we don't use in python-octaviaclient.
It also missed the CONTRIBUTING.rst document.

This patch corrects those issues.

commit_message:
Fix doc8 check

A previous patch added an ignore for the modules documentation
that we don't use in python-octaviaclient.
It also missed the CONTRIBUTING.rst document.

This patch corrects those issues.

Change-Id: Iddf03867321c08c50ed374c5e33552604f60c701

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-09 11:53:55.000000000', 'message': "tripleo_all_nodes_data: sort enabled_services (idempotency)

Sorting the enabled_services list so we can have idempotent hieradata
where the content doesn't change between Ansible runs of the
tripleo_all_nodes_data action plugin.

Change-Id: I8f54265dbadf21da6badd690f5cb123b549cf48c
(cherry picked from commit 9fefb30c5d08ee09d26f7b91d6fcd0b312215676)
"}]
commit_message:
tripleo_all_nodes_data: sort enabled_services (idempotency)

Sorting the enabled_services list so we can have idempotent hieradata
where the content doesn't change between Ansible runs of the
tripleo_all_nodes_data action plugin.

Change-Id: I8f54265dbadf21da6badd690f5cb123b549cf48c
(cherry picked from commit 9fefb30c5d08ee09d26f7b91d6fcd0b312215676)

(2 comments)

I agree that 'source' and 'openstack-origin' should be included in a README for any charm that supports those options. I was mostly concerned about the more archaic examples that made up the bulk of the *section* in this particular README. commit_message:
Review README

As per team discussion, Vault is the preferred method for SSL
management and Network spaces should not be mentioned in any
README pending a supporting documentation effort.

Change-Id: If8bc2f271be71caccd4f3f0b50f8ae412bef35b7

[{'created': '2020-03-19 21:25:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for encrypting backend HAProxy traffic to Keystone service

This patch introduces an optional backend encryption for Keystone
service. When used in conjunction with enabling TLS for service API
endpoints, network communcation will be encrypted end to end, from
client through HAProxy to the Keystone service.

Change-Id: I6351147ddaff8b2ae629179a9bc3bae2ebac9519
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-ssl-internal-network

commit_message:
Add support for encrypting backend Keystone HAProxy traffic

This patch introduces an optional backend encryption for Keystone
service. When used in conjunction with enabling TLS for service API
endpoints, network communcation will be encrypted end to end, from
client through HAProxy to the Keystone service.

Change-Id: I6351147ddaff8b2ae629179a9bc3bae2ebac9519
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-ssl-internal-network

commit_message:
Enable ConfigDebug for undercloud deployments

If undercloud_debug is true, we enable ConfigDebug so CI jobs can
provide more debug when things go wrong with config steps.

Change-Id: I4778b24866078c451997ffca3b9b80671f912b9d

commit_message:
DNM: Reproducer for bug #1843836

This doesn't really belong in 'test_numa_servers' and I'm not sure if
the modification to 'driver.py' is fixing a bug or if our stub of
'compareCPU' of 'fakelibvirt' is incomplete, but this serves to prove
the issue.

Change-Id: I167719dd72657e824b7e0183a09aa1a8cf0c4299
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Pass the actual target in server diagnostics policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for server diagnostics policies
which is server project_id because policy rule is system and
project scoped.

Adding tests also to show that rule can be override with project
roles.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ie9af539cf1cdbce14c30dbf89e4676ebc50f3246

[{'created': '2020-04-08 13:22:12.000000000', 'message': 'Use hashes.pkl files for LOSF and remove list_partition_recursive()

This removes LOSF specific code to speed up __get_hashes() and
yield_hashes(). We now inherit diskfile code, and where not possible,
copy it with minimal changes to make it work: change os.* calls to the
LOSF equivalent.

The performance impact is mitigated by the use of hashes.pkl files which

Change-Id: I3cb1fcffc8a09c356ed0e9f5e10f78ddc15cda9f

Change-Id: I3cb1fcffc8a09c356ed0e9f5e10f78ddc15cda9f
'}]
commit_message:
Use hashes.pkl files for LOSF and remove list_partition_recursive()

This removes LOSF specific code to speed up __get_hashes() and
yield_hashes(). We now inherit diskfile code, and where not possible,
copy it with minimal changes to make it work: change os.* calls to the
LOSF equivalent.

The performance impact is mitigated by the use of hashes.pkl files which
were previously disabled for LOSF. Further patches to the index-server
key-value layout will also make listing suffix content much cheaper.

Change-Id: I3cb1fcffc8a09c356ed0e9f5e10f78ddc15cda9f

Makes sense to me.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-04-08 16:48:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The problem I see with this is that by accepting a string or a bool, we'll have trouble later if we actually use a json schema to validate the request.  I think it would be better to check the value in the controller, and if it's not a "real" boolean value, raise a BadRequest.  I think that will be acceptable as long as the fact that a bool is expected is documented clearly.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-04-08 17:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-04-08 17:48:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-04-08 18:42:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Suggestion inline to locate the check in the RequestDeserializer instead.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-04-08 18:58:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

Thank you Brian, for review!!'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-04-08 19:08:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-04-08 19:41:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Review-Priority+1

Looks good.  I checked the api-ref, it does specify that these are boolean JSON types, and the example requests show them correctly as boolean.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-04-09 04:38:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-09 14:38:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Works for me, but I will leave it to someone else to approve.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-04-09 16:07:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fix multiple image imports if boolean input passed as string

If user passes 'all_stores_must_succeed' as 'false' in copy-image, multiple
image imports request body then it does not work as expected. Expected is
to skip the failure store and continue copying/importing image to other
stores but instead it stops execution of task and revert it and deletes
the image data copied/imported to previois stores.

Raised 400 BadRequest if 'all_stores_must_succeed' and 'all_stores' are
other thatn than boolean values.

NOTE: Documentation clearly suggest that we expect boolean values for
'all_stores_must_succeed' and 'all_stores'

Closes-Bug: #1871588
Change-Id: I5118489284fea007f8f29663581221b07a575cf3

commit_message:
Pass params to tripleo_plan_parameters_update as yaml_dump

Params are passed with YAML to tripleo_plan_parameters_update
to avoid errors.
A test has been added to ensure this functionality is exercised in
the gate.

Closes-Bug: #1871338
Change-Id: Idd0641a2f7be1d3d8c1995478590dc58370795b5
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Skip cpu comparison on AArch64

Host CPU compatibility check does not make sense on AArch64,
this patch skips CPU comparison.

Closes-bug: #1756118

commit_message:
Skip both tenant and management networks when generating certs

Without this change we were unable to deploy TLS Everywhere with
management network. This is because the service principal is not
created due to VIP being set to false in network_data.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1861097
Resolves: rhbz#1777605
Change-Id: I43fd5f67c1a0be6eaa1752575349e64329cada4a

commit_message:
Run fetch-subunit-output role conditionally

Jobs that inherit from base job don't always run unit tests or
use subunit. This post playbook will fail for them, so make subinit
role optional and set by default for true.
For example disable it for ansible collection functional jobs:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711471/
(cherry picked from commit 994c97e0bfbc1ac693e54ff14d4121f68c620b0d)

Change-Id: Ie147257f6ed12617c4ab04f3e2d4d6735551ee57
Signed-off-by: Sagi Shnaidman <sshnaidm@redhat.com>

subject: Fix HAProxy prechecks during scale-out with limit
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-02 10:20:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix HAProxy prechecks during scale-out with limit

Deploy HAProxy on one or more servers. Add another server to the
inventory in the haproxy group, and run the following:

kolla-ansible prechecks --limit <new host>

The following task will fail:

    TASK [haproxy : Checking if kolla_internal_vip_address and
    kolla_external_vip_address are not pingable from any node]

This happens because ansible does not execute on hosts where
haproxy/keepalived is running, and therefore does not know that the VIP
should be active.

This change skips VIP prechecks when not all HAProxy hosts are in the
play.

Closes-Bug: #1868986

Change-Id: Ifbc73806b768f76f803ab01c115a9e5c2e2492ac
(cherry picked from commit f3350d4e130b17b4035a8b67420d7015fc6cc99b)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix HAProxy prechecks during scale-out with limit

Deploy HAProxy on one or more servers. Add another server to the
inventory in the haproxy group, and run the following:

kolla-ansible prechecks --limit <new host>

The following task will fail:

    TASK [haproxy : Checking if kolla_internal_vip_address and
    kolla_external_vip_address are not pingable from any node]

This happens because ansible does not execute on hosts where
haproxy/keepalived is running, and therefore does not know that the VIP
should be active.

This change skips VIP prechecks when not all HAProxy hosts are in the
play.

Closes-Bug: #1868986

Change-Id: Ifbc73806b768f76f803ab01c115a9e5c2e2492ac
(cherry picked from commit f3350d4e130b17b4035a8b67420d7015fc6cc99b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-08 09:00:46.000000000', 'message': 'Burn configdrive into virtual media boot ISO

Added config drive handling in ``redfish-virtual-media`` boot
interface.

If config drive information is present in node ``instance_info``,
``redfish` virtual media boot interface will burn it into boot ISO in
form of a FAT partition image file.

Booted node coulld then mount virtual media device, then mount
config drive partition image and access node configuration
information.

Change-Id: Ib5ed0ce09ce97ddb914fa4f830265dfc24a0bc1a
'}, {'created': '2019-10-08 13:19:53.000000000', 'message': 'Burn configdrive into virtual media boot ISO

Added config drive handling in ``redfish-virtual-media`` boot
interface.

If config drive information is present in node ``instance_info``,
``redfish` virtual media boot interface will burn it into boot ISO in
form of a FAT partition image file.

Booted node coulld then mount virtual media device, then mount
config drive partition image and access node configuration
information.

Change-Id: Ib5ed0ce09ce97ddb914fa4f830265dfc24a0bc1a
'}, {'created': '2019-10-09 13:35:41.000000000', 'message': 'Burn configdrive into virtual media boot ISO

Added config-drive handling to ``redfish-virtual-media`` boot
interface.

If config-drive information is present in node ``instance_info``,
``redfish` virtual media boot interface will burn it into boot ISO in
form of a FAT partition image file.

Booted node could then mount virtual media device, then mount
config drive partition image and access node configuration
information.

One of the probable use-cases for this feature is to pass L3
network configuration to os-net-config / cloud-init tools running
in the tenant operating system.

Change-Id: Ib5ed0ce09ce97ddb914fa4f830265dfc24a0bc1a
Story: 2006691
Task: 36990

network configuration to os-net-config / cloud-init tools running

'}, {'created': '2019-11-26 11:04:50.000000000', 'message': 'Burn configdrive into virtual media boot ISO

Added config-drive handling to ``redfish-virtual-media`` boot
interface.

If config-drive information is present in node ``instance_info``,
``redfish` virtual media boot interface will burn it into boot ISO in
form of a FAT partition image file.

Booted node could then mount virtual media device, then mount
config drive partition image and access node configuration
information.

One of the probable use-cases for this feature is to pass L3
network configuration to os-net-config / cloud-init tools running
in the tenant operating system.

Change-Id: Ib5ed0ce09ce97ddb914fa4f830265dfc24a0bc1a

commit_message:
Support burning configdrive into boot ISO

Adds the ability to write configdrive contents on the boot
images that ironic produces. Such boot image will be labeled
as `config-2` to facilitate tools like `cloud-init` or `Glean`
to find configuration source there.

As of this commit, the new code is not used by anything in
ironic yet.

Change-Id: Ib5ed0ce09ce97ddb914fa4f830265dfc24a0bc1a
Story: 2006691
Task: 36990

node_config: document ExtraGroupVars

ExtraGroupVars is a new interface to allow the overriding of Ansible
group vars in TripleO; it was backported down to Train.

haproxy rules are enforced (previously this was not the case):
$ grep 'Run puppet on the host to apply IPtables rules' update-controller-2.log

commit_message:
Move the haproxy iptables rules creation to host_prep_tasks

The reason for this is that under deploy_tasks they won't be run during
an update (until the converge command is run). This is problematic
because in a composable HA being updated the haproxy firewall rules
might disappear due to other tasks cleaning the rules up and they won't
be recreated until converge. The problem is that that the temporary
containers will run during the minor update and try to access the db
which is now effectively firewalled off.

Historically this was at step 2, because haproxy was configured during
that step. Nothing should prevent us from creating the rules before and
that is what we do for the non-haproxy rules too anyway.

While moving it we need to take out the code from
::tripleo::profile::base::haproxy and use it directly because we do not
have the required 'step' variable set in host_prep_tasks and silly
puppet has now way of passing a hiera value on the command line (or via
other simple means)

Tested as follows:
1) Deployed a fresh Train environment with this patch and correctly
observed the haproxy fw rules:
[root@controller-0 ~]# iptables -nvL INPUT |grep _haproxy |wc -l
27

2) Ran a minor update of controller-2, controller-1 and controller-0
(in that order) and verified that afterwards all _haproxy rules
are in place *before* the converge.

3) Confirmed that in the minor update logs we do see the step where
haproxy rules are enforced (previously this was not the case):
$ grep 'Run puppet on the host to apply IPtables rules' update-controller-2.log
TASK [Run puppet on the host to apply IPtables rules] **************************

4) Run a full minor update + converge of a composable HA environment

Closes-Bug: #1871646

Change-Id: Icba8a8292d1e2675c7da3513d00a4a0f4191747e

messages:
[{'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2020-03-16 16:32:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2020-03-17 16:25:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-17 16:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29874, 'date': '2020-03-18 01:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-03-18 08:05:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks Terry for this :)!'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2020-03-20 15:23:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2020-04-09 16:23:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit 5fec1d724461e24206e2c1f66ad6ba8e342d4879'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-16 16:32:58.000000000', 'message': "Call row.verify() when updating map columns with db_set

The verify() method will ensure that if the row's column in the db
has changed since we set it, that we will be notified and try the
transaction again with new values. This is important when we do a
read-update operation like we do for map columns in db_set. Since
we read the values add a few keys, then overwrite the whole value,
it is important that we don't do that if we have stale data.

Since ovs 2.6, there has been a setkey() operation that would
allow modifying a map w/o overwriting the whole value, but there
is a bug where it doesn't handle maps that have a refTable value
like Qos.queues. So using that before it is fixed [1] and all
packages have picked it up would cause breakage.

[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/1254735/

Closes-bug: #1867652
Change-Id: Ic898cefb4ced76e9e169b9f5d6caaace600abb0c
"}]
commit_message:
Call row.verify() when updating map columns with db_set

The verify() method will ensure that if the row's column in the db
has changed since we set it, that we will be notified and try the
transaction again with new values. This is important when we do a
read-update operation like we do for map columns in db_set. Since
we read the values add a few keys, then overwrite the whole value,
it is important that we don't do that if we have stale data.

Since ovs 2.6, there has been a setkey() operation that would
allow modifying a map w/o overwriting the whole value, but there
is a bug where it doesn't handle maps that have a refTable value
like Qos.queues. So using that before it is fixed [1] and all
packages have picked it up would cause breakage.

[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/1254735/

Closes-bug: #1867652
Change-Id: Ic898cefb4ced76e9e169b9f5d6caaace600abb0c

commit_message:
Deprecate KeepalivedRestart

KeepalivedRestart is deprecated and has no effect. The workaround isn't
needed anymore since we now deploy keepalived-2.0.10-4.
This version has support for 'dynamic_interfaces' which is required when
the network config was changed and os-net-config restarts the network
interface.

Related-Bug: #1791238
Change-Id: I14c51106ad1ee40a6edfa520d330d1ea0a52edee
(cherry picked from commit f3d4eaef225098d4323cc44f852762d617a10f54)

I thought we had a problem with logs per API request happening. For me all the policy logs should ideally happen only on startup.

I get you may want a "checking" mode that warns operators if any policy only passed because it fell back to the deprecated policy (e.g. it was a per project admin not a system scoped token), but that should be separate to the warnings on startup.

I assume if we had an empty policy file there would be no warning on startup, except I could see you having a log message that says you may want to enable checking mode to ensure things work for you next cycle, etc.

I am not sure the best way forward here I guess...'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-04-07 15:51:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I thought we had a problem with logs per API request happening. For
 > me all the policy logs should ideally happen only on startup.

 > I get you may want a "checking" mode that warns operators if any
 > policy only passed because it fell back to the deprecated policy
 > (e.g. it was a per project admin not a system scoped token), but
 > that should be separate to the warnings on startup.
 > 
 > I assume if we had an empty policy file there would be no warning
 > on startup, except I could see you having a log message that says
 > you may want to enable checking mode to ensure things work for you
 > next cycle, etc.
 > 
 > I am not sure the best way forward here I guess...

actually if default check_str are changed they log warning if empty policy file (rule not in file) only that is why we saw lot of wanrings. this is diable only those wanring and if policy name is changed and it is in policy file then keep logging wanrning same way.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2020-04-08 08:49:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I would be tempted to more clearly capture the intent here in the commit message, it confused me somehow :/

But I also think I'm bike shedding about that so +2 anyway.

I'm holding off on approving until the testing on the followup patch is done."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-04-09 05:25:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

This commit adds a new flag to control the wanring for policies changing
their defaults check_str only. There is no change for Policy changing their
name or marked for removal.

New flag is default to False to no change in behaviour for old users.
