commit_message:
Allow disabling the default check_str change warnings

When policy change their default check_str and not override by
operator then warnings are being logged which is ok when few
policy are changing their defaults but in case of adopting the
new defaults provided by keystone, all policies has to change
their defaults.

Nova has lot of policies which are changing their defaults. All
those warnings started filling the logs. n-api log was 256 MB.

- https://6d82362f2cdc504b27f1-9f757b11a1d2b00e739d31e1ecad199a.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/717662/1/check/tempest-integrated-compute/b3260ce/controller/logs/screen-n-api.txt
- http://paste.openstack.org/show/791678/

Nova added workaround by suppressing all the warning via flag used
to disable for testing 'suppress_deprecation_warnings'.
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717802/

This commit adds a new flag to control the warning for policies changing
their defaults check_str only. There is no change for Policy changing their
name or marked for removal.

New flag is default to False to no change in behaviour for old users.

Change-Id: If7a467a12d5d272180fa8061d12e5f2699c08282

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib374e5974fe8eba630bc3d0eaf531175cf58c885

commit_message:
Remove unused version parameter in version header function

The logic to determine the version when getting the ironic version
header is not influenced by the version parameter passed to the
function.

Change-Id: Ie52a82bf71a2277cea11fd2dedfd9c1e0001d95f

commit_message:
Use CentOS8 to run unit tests and lint tests

This patch makes CentOS8 jobs voting and CentOS7 jobs disabled for
unit tests and lint tests, so that we use CentOS8 for default CentOS
to run jobs for current master.

Change-Id: Ic6abf9f09bb687e830a06e7129f77e2504ea8e2a
(cherry picked from commit fc189a89739c71f8cb4b8b3ba7c60333ff0735c6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-09 06:37:43.000000000', 'message': 'Filter out switch port descriptions on Ruckus switches

Some Ruckus switches, e.g. the Ruckus ICX 7150, advertise switch
interface names as switch port descriptions. Unlike Dell switches, there
is no space character between port type and port number. For example:
GigabitEthernet1/1/9.

Update regular expression to match both styles.

Change-Id: I359b07abadc8665ff0a8c3407ca0fc5effc504cf
Story: 2007532
Task: 39343
'}]
commit_message:
Filter out switch port descriptions on Ruckus switches

Some Ruckus switches, e.g. the Ruckus ICX 7150, advertise switch
interface names as switch port descriptions. Unlike Dell switches, there
is no space character between port type and port number. For example:
GigabitEthernet1/1/9.

Update regular expression to match both styles.

Change-Id: I359b07abadc8665ff0a8c3407ca0fc5effc504cf
Story: 2007532
Task: 39343

commit_message:
Cleanup Python 2.7 support

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove section from setup.cfg: Wheel is not needed for python
  3 only repo
- Remove ancient sections from setup.cfg
- Update requirements
- Update api-ref/source/conf.py for current openstackdocstheme
- Don't test for broken po files, this is done in the infra scripts
  since a long time
- Change shebang lines to use python3

Change-Id: If5276a47b8822c5c19d045fbc5c41394f4a9dd2d

commit_message:
Retire OSA repo_build and pip_install projects

This is final step in retirement of openstack-ansible-repo_build and
openstack-ansible-pip_install projects.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/717832/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/717717
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/716389
Change-Id: Ib91e58cec330f702620d789d0c52aa3c4c4e8f4d

commit_message:
Stop assuming a specific inventory structure

It's not safe to assume the ansible inventory follows a particular
structure e.g that overcloud group contains children or role groups
contain hosts

Instead use jinja filters from tripleo-ansible to flatten the inventory
to group->host mapping and list the tripleo role, regardless of the
parent/child group relationships.

Depends-On: I8a47c945656558a0d3baa67a5547f0d859f8c816
Change-Id: If022a4647aaebc4b212bba188cc959ff2f8f9311

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python using both Python 2 and 3 now, so update hacking to
version 2.0 which supports Python 2 and 3. Note that latest hacking
release 3.0 only supports version 3.

Fix problems found.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not needed
for installation.

Change-Id: I9bd913ee1b32ba1566c420973723296766d1812f

commit_message:
Update grafana for ceph to reflect current jobs

This makes some updates to reflect currently running jobs for:

  * cinder:  tempest-integrated-storage
  * glance:  tempest-integrated-storage
             devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest-py3
  * tempest: tempest-full-py3
             devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest-py3

This also adds a graph for the Nova stable/train branch.

Change-Id: I18f4f79f6e65874f514a1782132996218a33825a

subject: Add spec-lite to deprecate admin_role
messages:
[{'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-03-24 12:51:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-03-26 03:21:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Agree for deprecation in Ussuri.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-26 14:20:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2020-04-07 10:21:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Like mentioned when this was discussed, I'm not against deprecating this feature if it's not widely used. I'd just really prefer us starting with the alternate option mentioned in this spec to address the immediate concerns (the fact that we're defaulting to "admin" which is commonly used role in deployments) while we go through the deprecation steps and assert the usage patterns as per [0].

commit_message:
Make tripleo_shell_script more robust

1. avoid "null" (NoneType) env variables
2. ensures "quote()" gets only string

Change-Id: Id62b0dd5e952cb70aa4d773195dcab6dc78cae1a

commit_message:
Ensure we don't pass empty params

When using automated generation for some of the params we get an empty
line entry at some point, leading to an empty parameter being added to
the command.

The unit-test was updated accordingly in order to avoid regressions.

Change-Id: I82c9e68bea1a206c001f71873c213c0242380345

commit_message:
Skip cpu comparison on AArch64

Host CPU compatibility check does not make sense on AArch64,
this patch skips CPU comparison.

Closes-bug: #1756118

Change-Id: I0ef4b954b7f4ae65b6c0f96580c5f9472a2b873c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevinzs2048@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4bb54ae86981d186e41dcc325d171ab951beb7b6)
(cherry picked from commit ef88647974c91d500edf09d1c57bfeac552a1085)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-26 18:03:09.000000000', 'message': 'Add cap for hacking

We want to limit the maximum version of hacking installed since the
global upper constraints does not do this for linters. Otherwise when a
new release of hacking is available in the future, stable branches may
suddenly be broken.

commit_message:
Bump hacking to 3.0.0

This patch update hacking version to 3.0.0. It also drop flake8 and
hacking from lower-constraints.txt and update mccabe, pycodestyle,
pyflakes package version to fix error in lower-constraints job [1].

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/b11dcae1771d4d9ab7d30c40848bd2ff/log/tox/lower-constraints-1.log#354-356

Change-Id: Idd32fc49cb7c8d9823385eee7b42e8e6e769c108

commit_message:
Fix new context comparison workaround in base tests class

There is new contexts added in policy test base class that needs
to be added in all tests. Meanwhile we added a workaround not
to assert if that new context is missing.

This commit improve that work around so that we do not assert only
if new context is missing which is from below review comment
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716793/5/nova/tests/unit/policies/base.py@138

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: If94865e9fcc92f4c7580315847d3da5d4aebe4a3

commit_message:
Don't call sdk.connect() again

openstack_cloud_from_module() returns a connection object.

Change-Id: Icda289b76b8b57857e6ace521c7984b70ba04392

commit_message:
kibana: use Linaro provided package for Ubuntu/aarch64

Package is in 'debian-buster' repo but it is usable on Ubuntu as well.

It is repackaged upstream one.

Change-Id: I8bc90bff4b96333a131f019b1c3c166f7f39c35f

capturing some of the irc conversation with mwhahaha this afternoon further to the conversation with sagi and panda on v12


17:15 < marios> mwhahaha: can you check the discussion when you have time please and revote ... me and sshnaidm are having a discussion there https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716639/12/roles/tripleo_overcloud_roles_generate/molecule/default/converge.yml
17:16 < marios> perhaps wait for molecule to run first ;/
17:16 < marios> thanks
17:17 <@mwhahaha> marios: i'm not a fan of using the jinja in the expected values
17:17 <@mwhahaha> fwiw
17:17 < marios> mwhahaha: yes that is what the discussion was about
17:17 < marios> mwhahaha: i mean, it is passed in a block so the same vars that go in the input are expected in the output
17:18 < marios>  i don't see the problem but... this is the same discussion i already had with sshnaidm on the review and here earlier
17:18 < openstackgerrit> Emilien Macchi proposed openstack/tripleo-ansible master: tripleo_all_nodes_data: sort enabled_services (idempotency)  https://review.opendev.org/718471
17:18 <@mwhahaha> we've seen similar patterns break down in the python bits
17:18 <@mwhahaha> i prefer to be explicit
17:18 < marios> tidied up the block in v13 easier to read perhaps https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716639/13/roles/tripleo_overcloud_roles_generate/molecule/default/converge.yml
17:18 < marios> 17:18 <@mwhahaha> we've seen similar patterns break down in the python bits
17:18 < marios> sigh
17:18 < marios> ok 
17:19 < marios> mwhahaha: break down where in ci you mean ? 
17:19 < marios> mwhahaha: still not clear what breaks 
17:19 < marios> mwhahaha: i mean this is the molecul scenario we're talking about 
17:20 <@mwhahaha> the point of those tests in that repo is to test the vars make to the output as expected
17:20 < marios> mwhahaha: yes exactly, so i use the *exact same* vars: for input and output check 
17:20 <@mwhahaha> i'm not seeing the benefit as defined
17:21 <@mwhahaha> it's actually more code the way you have defined it
17:21 < marios> mwhahaha: how is it more code. 
17:21 < marios> mwhahaha: the benefit is easier maintenance, cos you only have to update the vars: and not update the test 
17:22 <@mwhahaha> i don't agree it's easier maintance
17:23 <@mwhahaha> https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-operator-ansible/blob/master/roles/tripleo_config_generate_ansible/molecule/default/converge.yml#L35-L45 is vastly less than 
                  https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716639/12/roles/tripleo_overcloud_roles_generate/molecule/default/converge.yml@65
17:24 < marios> mwhahaha: how so

17:28 < marios> mwhahaha: you claimed it was vastly more maintenance to do it my way but i showed you it is in fact the opposite

17:29 < marios> mwhahaha: but doing ... 
17:29 <@mwhahaha> just because you don't doesn't mean it's not there
17:29 <@mwhahaha> we already doo too much complex shit
17:29 <@mwhahaha> please don't continue with that
17:29 < marios> mwhahaha: well, sure but its not enough to say 'added complexity' as an abstract without pointint to the thing that is adding it. what in my review adds complexity

Adds overcloud roles generate role - creates roles_data.yaml

Tracked by tripleo squad at [1]. Implements the openstack
overcloud roles generate command to create the roles.yml
file from your THT directory /roles. Tracked by tripleo-ci squad
with [2].

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/tripleo-operator-ansible
[2] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1598

commit_message:
base/debian: pin erlang 22 for rabbitmq

Without pinning:

INFO:kolla.common.utils.rabbitmq: rabbitmq-server : Depends: erlang-base (>= 1:21.3) but 1:21.2.6+dfsg-1 is to be installed or
INFO:kolla.common.utils.rabbitmq:                            erlang-base-hipe (>= 1:21.3) but it is not installable or
INFO:kolla.common.utils.rabbitmq:                            esl-erlang (>= 1:21.3) but it is not installable

With pinning image builds.

Change-Id: I26bbd081f70ac76bcf45ab4348068e463a313d88

The existing two unit tests are failing due to the changes
merged [1] in heat-translator 2.0.0 version.

Failing two unit tests:-
tacker.tests.unit.vnfm.infra_drivers.openstack.test_openstack.TestOpenStack
1) test_create_tosca_alarm_scale

commit_message:
Set default boot option to netboot for jobs using cirros

An upcoming ironic change changes the default boot option for nodes
to local booting as opposed to the long standing default netboot.

Some jobs still use cirros, which cannot be local booted from a
partition image as it is designed to write the ramdisk contents
to the partition upon the initial network boot.

Change-Id: I0d0c043de449048c3cc38ed7d7dac3e9e85974ef

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers

Change-Id: I34abafc045b4f50ded19bd0b8d87fa3c77f1a1b9

commit_message:
Temporary failures should be treated as temporary.

There is no reason e.g to treat timeouts as permanent and thus these
sources should not be removed from polling.

Change-Id: Ifcb8dc7ca2c91f3d2482264afbd81df6e51c5937

commit_message:
Add support for encrypting backend HAProxy traffic

This patch introduces an optional backend encryption that can be added
to openstack services.

Change-Id: I216507940014e99f3fc1746016625cf0ff5f0efb
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-ssl-internal-network

[{'created': '2020-04-05 08:16:18.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Change-Id: Ibcee6e71253fceb4c46442646a99f3b58e9df26d
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Change-Id: Ibcee6e71253fceb4c46442646a99f3b58e9df26d

commit_message:
tripleo_all_nodes_data: sort enabled_services (idempotency)

Sorting the enabled_services list so we can have idempotent hieradata
where the content doesn't change between Ansible runs of the
tripleo_all_nodes_data action plugin.

Change-Id: I8f54265dbadf21da6badd690f5cb123b549cf48c

[{'created': '2020-04-08 15:34:21.000000000', 'message': "Deprecate KeepalivedRestart

KeepalivedRestart is deprecated and has no effect. The workaround isn't
needed anymore since we now deploy keepalived-2.0.10-4.
This version has support for 'dynamic_interfaces' which is required when
the network config was changed and os-net-config restarts the network
interface.

Related-Bug: #1791238
Change-Id: I14c51106ad1ee40a6edfa520d330d1ea0a52edee
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate KeepalivedRestart

KeepalivedRestart is deprecated and has no effect. The workaround isn't
needed anymore since we now deploy keepalived-2.0.10-4.
This version has support for 'dynamic_interfaces' which is required when
the network config was changed and os-net-config restarts the network
interface.

Related-Bug: #1791238
Change-Id: I14c51106ad1ee40a6edfa520d330d1ea0a52edee

Fixed test related to tag-ext

according to bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1682775
tag-ext renamed to standard-attr-tag, after Stein release.

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support and docs

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Use sphinx-build for building, fix problems found
- Cleanup tox.ini
- Use newer openstackdocstheme option, remove obsolete config

Change-Id: I7a3788858af70d4349d21dcf04907b42365985c1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-09 09:28:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add version info into doc

Vitrage have multiple versions of the template syntax. Although the check and
upload service may have a default version  I think the template verison should
be added to the meta in each example, after all, the default version will change
with the code version upgrade.

Change-Id: Ia74458073891bd273a5c51ccdf386b8ea702cd20
'}]
commit_message:
Add version info into doc

Vitrage have multiple versions of the template syntax. Although the check and
upload service may have a default version  I think the template verison should
be added to the meta in each example, after all, the default version will change
with the code version upgrade.

Change-Id: Ia74458073891bd273a5c51ccdf386b8ea702cd20

subject: Cleanup py27 support
revisions:

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine.

Change-Id: Iecc1931e93b2254b7b3c95ba1daafd32db204754

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 08:05:18.000000000', 'message': "Fix server password policy to be admin_or_owner

server password API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1] but API
is allowed for everyone.

We can see the test trying with other project context can access the API
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717204

This is because API does not pass the server project_id in policy target[2]
and if no target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which is
nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone who try to access)[3]

This commit fix this policy by passing the server's project_id in policy
target.

Closes-bug: #1870488
Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e487b05f7e451af4f29699c3b34d9d2cc1b1205a/nova/policies/server_password.py#L27
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e487b05f7e451af4f29699c3b34d9d2cc1b1205a/nova/api/openstack/compute/server_password.py#L34
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

Change-Id: I4cf3fef325b09f1452642f22dc121d2820586a7a
"}, {'created': '2020-04-04 00:16:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix server password policy to be admin_or_owner

server password API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1] but API
is allowed for everyone.

We can see the test trying with other project context can access the API
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717204

This is because API does not pass the server project_id in policy target[2]
and if no target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which is
nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone who try to access)[3]

This commit fix this policy by passing the server's project_id in policy
target.

Closes-bug: #1870488
Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e487b05f7e451af4f29699c3b34d9d2cc1b1205a/nova/policies/server_password.py#L27
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e487b05f7e451af4f29699c3b34d9d2cc1b1205a/nova/api/openstack/compute/server_password.py#L34
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

Change-Id: I4cf3fef325b09f1452642f22dc121d2820586a7a

commit_message:
Fix server password policy to be admin_or_owner

server password API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1] but API
is allowed for everyone.

We can see the test trying with other project context can access the API
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717204

This is because API does not pass the server project_id in policy target[2]
and if no target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which is
nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone who try to access)[3]

This commit fix this policy by passing the server's project_id in policy
target.

Closes-bug: #1870488
Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e487b05f7e451af4f29699c3b34d9d2cc1b1205a/nova/policies/server_password.py#L27
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e487b05f7e451af4f29699c3b34d9d2cc1b1205a/nova/api/openstack/compute/server_password.py#L34
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

Change-Id: I4cf3fef325b09f1452642f22dc121d2820586a7a

[{'created': '2020-04-08 11:46:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix issue with VirtualBMC client path

If SELinux is enforcing we install VirtualBMC as a system Python
package. The module is executed using become, and root typically doesn't
have /usr/local/bin/ in it's PATH.

Use an absolute path to resolve this issue.

Change-Id: Ia278518d2c55351c55abca1122e7cad7179ad4d8

commit_message:
Fix issue with VirtualBMC client path

If SELinux is enforcing we install VirtualBMC as a system Python
package. The module is executed using become, and root typically doesn't
have /usr/local/bin/ in it's PATH.

Use an absolute path to resolve this issue.

Change-Id: Ia278518d2c55351c55abca1122e7cad7179ad4d8

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in server password policy

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for server password API policies
as ['system', 'project'].

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I8f5e66810c68a871e57a5362a931545bccded608

commit_message:
Validate node `network_data` field contents

Make Redfish boot interface performing formal JSON document
validation of node `network_data` field content against
user-supplied JSON schema at driver validation step.

Change-Id: Iafcf76755320c206838999a1a72620b45a8cba00
Story: 2006691
Task: 36991

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 07:19:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing server password policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing server password policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I70db39ab47e972488bf19f2a53c4d96ab9c3979a

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing server password policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing server password policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I70db39ab47e972488bf19f2a53c4d96ab9c3979a

soon affect Ussuri CI [1], let's use unittest.mock built in py3.

This also fixes py38 jobs and proactively prevents py36 and py37
failing due to [1]. This is because we never included mock in
test-requirements and instead relied on oslotest to bring it in.

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of PyPI mock

Now that py2 is gone, oslotest dropped dependency on mock and will
soon affect Ussuri CI [1], let's use unittest.mock built in py3.

This also fixes py38 jobs and proactively prevents py36 and py37
failing due to [1]. This is because we never included mock in
test-requirements and instead relied on oslotest to bring it in.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/716322

Change-Id: I0c18b13c4e1fbaa9db41da4e2039ad908c28caa6

subject: Fix lower-constraints tox target
messages:
[{'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-01-16 15:51:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-01-17 09:21:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-01-22 15:27:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2020-01-22 16:02:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I would have expected that dependencies for neutron and neutron-lib would be picked from git rather than pypi, since these are declared in .zuul.yaml required-project for the openstack-tox-lower-constraints job.

But given the purpose of the lower-constraints job, this is probably intentional that they aren't.

Now that I think about the topic, it seems likely to me that the job has been made non-voting for this particular reason.  It would be worth asking around to people knowing the check-requirements job if there is a solution to that.

Perhaps one thing to try would be to formulate the dependency to neutron and neutron-lib in lower-constraints.txt as a git URL pointing to master branches.

Another option is: wait for the first beta release of neutron and neutron-lib to be pushed to pypi and then use this version in lower-constraints.txt (but keep the job non-voting because the same issue may arise again in the future)."}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-01-23 14:46:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> I would have expected that dependencies for neutron and neutron-lib
 > would be picked from git rather than pypi, since these are declared
 > in .zuul.yaml required-project for the openstack-tox-lower-constraints
 > job.
 > 
 > But given the purpose of the lower-constraints job, this is
 > probably intentional that they aren't.
 > 
 > Now that I think about the topic, it seems likely to me that the
 > job has been made non-voting for this particular reason.  It would
 > be worth asking around to people knowing the check-requirements job
 > if there is a solution to that.
 > 
 > Perhaps one thing to try would be to formulate the dependency to
 > neutron and neutron-lib in lower-constraints.txt as a git URL
 > pointing to master branches.
 > 
 > Another option is: wait for the first beta release of neutron and
 > neutron-lib to be pushed to pypi and then use this version in
 > lower-constraints.txt (but keep the job non-voting because the same
 > issue may arise again in the future).

Yeah, perhaps the best is to wait for an ussuri neutron release."}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-04-06 07:48:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-04-06 09:56:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-04-06 13:50:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-04-06 14:47:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-04-06 16:07:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-04-07 05:26:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Published edit on patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-04-07 07:47:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-04-07 12:13:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-04-07 13:50:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
Drop eventlet from lower constraints

oslo.service has bumped the min requirement to 0.22.0 with
commit 19517d0bd6b34a54ae2779aff98af5172c09e4b6.

It's not directly used in tripleo-validations and there is
no reason to constrain it.

Change-Id: Icb6591068c7d13e5adc6e5876fea07063163b43e
(cherry picked from commit 2ff7cbcae14942a4e52854544108e3b6494500d5)

commit_message:
Properly place undercloud hosts record upgrade task

Undercloud record for hosts has to be in all the nodes that fetch
images from it. Proper location for this code is where we set up
podman. If it's only in ContainerImagesPrepare it runs on the
Controller role only.

Closes-Bug: #1871243

Change-Id: Id081f049bca6c961ad2ff649ac357cea8d552739

[{'created': '2020-04-04 14:55:38.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Remove html_last_updated_fmt from conf.py, this is not needed with
  openstackdocstheme anymore; update openstackdocstheme requirement

Change-Id: I8811b249e53df8e25c46fe63d71b7dbb400dac19
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Remove html_last_updated_fmt from conf.py, this is not needed with
  openstackdocstheme anymore; update openstackdocstheme requirement

Change-Id: I8811b249e53df8e25c46fe63d71b7dbb400dac19

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

Change-Id: I43ce218444e5a66b4589facf344b6a3a5481d12b

commit_message:
Release final python-karborclient for ussuri

Final ussuri client lib release for the April 9 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: I9c9ad02e1c22d751b84ec3f1e021060674bad977
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Hi DingDong, since you are planning to enable these tests on your CI after this change merges, can you provide us some tests outputs for these functionalities that you are adding? Thanks'}, {'account_id': 29291, 'date': '2020-02-24 06:25:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hi, here are test steps I tookï¼

----Make sure there is share server in backend, the test server is with ip address 192.168.133.206, and has shares in it.

----Prepare the share network first
$ openstack network create demo_network
$ openstack subnet create demo_subnet --network demo_network --subnet-range 192.168.133.0/24
$ openstack port create --network demo_network --fixed-ip subnet=demo_subnet,ip-address=192.168.133.206 demo_port --device-owner=manila:share
$ manila share-network-create --name demo_share_network --neutron-net-id 5564ad88-475b-4196-8d5e-d659c5754f5d  --neutron-subnet-id 9817062d-50f0-4c4d-bec0-ebdf5d3329a8

----manage share server
$ manila share-server-manage openstack-huangy18-03@Unity  demo_share_network nfs_server_dd

----manage share 
$ manila manage openstack-huangy18-03@Unity#Flash_pool nfs '192.168.133.206:/test_nfs_dd_03' --name demo_share --driver_options size=6  --share_type dhss_true --share_server_id 9d715ddb-f9be-43da-a8ec-b172eb719eb3

----manage snapshot
$ manila snapshot-manage --name demo_snapsot demo_share nfs_snapshot_03 --driver_options size=6


The steps are list in release note: dell-emc-unity-driver.rst.
Also unmanages commands are also list in the file."}, {'account_id': 29291, 'date': '2020-02-24 06:29:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

And every time after manage-xxx commands, the related resource will be registered in manila service. And can be used for other commands or be deleted as regular resources.'}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2020-02-24 16:21:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

- infortrend-manila-ci http://openstack.infortrend.com/1138/688227/15/check/infortrend-manila-ci/252a7e811807903b3011081859ea0f9ab42cfe8e : FAILURE'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-04-08 23:21:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2

In the interest of getting this through before Feature Freeze, I went ahead and made some minor corrections regarding the use of exception classes and the concerning unit test; but haven't changed anything substantial that should affect the feature functionality as it is written. 

Currently, the DHSS=True CI job for Unity has been affected because of the changes made to manila recently concerning CVE-2020-9543 [1]. The maintainers of the Dell-EMC Unity driver and its CI system, have conveyed to reviewers that they have temporarily worked around the problem by using tempest test accounts [2] that all belong to a single project. This workaround was chosen because of the compulsion to use pre-configured share networks with manila-tempest-plugin [3] which is needed because of a current bug with manila tempest plugin [4]. 

Due to this workaround, negative tests added recently to the tempest plugin suite will fail on the DHSS=True Unity job [5]

So, I am okay with this temporary workaround as a reviewer; I'd like to provide the maintainers time to fix this issue in their CI system. 

The manage/unmanage share, snapshot and share server tests are passing on the last patchset; however, a substantial number of the share server tests are getting skipped, as they should while using pre-configured share networks. 


[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1861485
[2] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/test-accounts.html
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/src/commit/b5ed5dfaa5ed4989bdefc30abb00902a46052951/manila_tempest_tests/config.py#L133-L154
[4] https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1699856
[5] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710661/"}, {'account_id': 29632, 'date': '2020-04-08 23:30:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2

LGTM. Thanks for working on this!'}, {'account_id': 14624, 'date': '2020-04-09 00:19:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

run-DellEMC Unity CI'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-04-09 01:13:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2020-04-09 02:12:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Leave a comment with 'run-DellEMC Unity CI' to trigger a recheck. For more information about CI, please see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DellEMC_Unity_CI"}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2020-04-09 02:34:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM, Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 14624, 'date': '2020-04-09 02:54:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Hi Goutham,

Iâve solved the issue completely with test accounts approach.
We should put admin users into admin project instead of the project(demo) of manila share network.
Below is an example test accounts file for MANILA_TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY=1
( Normally, 2 x MANILA_TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY non-admin users and MANILA_TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY * admin users are required for running tempest test cases successfully. )
========================
- domain_name: Default
  password: "password"
  project_name: demo
  resources:
    network: unity-net
  username: tempest_user1
- domain_name: Default
  password: "password"
  project_name: demo
  resources:
    network: unity-net
  username: tempest_user2
- domain_name: Default
  password: "password"
  project_name: admin
  resources:
    network: unity-net
  types:
  - admin
  username: tempest_admin1
=======================

Now all test cases have passed.

Thanks and regards.
Sam'}]

commit_message:
[Unity] Manage/unmanage share server/share/snap

1. Try parse share_backend_id from export path in case
it is managed share.

2. Try to take snapshot id from 'provider_location' in case
this is managed snapshot

3. Try to get share server name from property 'identifier'
first in case this is managed share server

4. Add property 'provider_location' when creating snapshot

Implements: blueprint emc-unity-manage-unmange

Change-Id: I676475d0500ecce31a1a863926accec8585ac83a
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Repair creating an ironicclient instance

Session is now required and can only be automatically created via
client.get_client. Switch to using get_client.

Change-Id: I0db7a95c4a99fe4157b3623a14135eb7b5dd69d9
(cherry picked from commit 974838e37e11c33ec4083764678701886cafea3b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 06:25:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing server metadata policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing server metadata policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I787dfe516cfca2838fa5cc4850a4072b8a79515f

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing server metadata policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing server metadata policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I787dfe516cfca2838fa5cc4850a4072b8a79515f

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Require newer pbr
- Remove install_command, the default is fine

Change-Id: I975a7012c42b8ee2c30d3a33fc63a083738d8007

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: Ia5a6219d6c4cc2cb10ddaeee22b957ca85064ab9
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix AttributeError in check allowed port fields

When the 'local_link_connection' field is None an
AttributeError is raised when attempting to get the
keys.

Add a check for None before trying to get the keys.

Closes-Bug: #1871346
Change-Id: I5855aea79d6322f70f95709e1a87b8bda3282435

When storage type is specified, the bundles can
only be deployed on a matching substrate.

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This commit cleanup below:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Add "ignore_basepython_conflict=True" to tox.ini

Change-Id: Ic4fcc1fb15f214ca4204f56ee1ea15dc6a782fc2

[{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-11-21 17:30:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-11-21 17:30:58.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to fix-periodic'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-11-21 17:33:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Periodic job (py27) fails for some time now for nova-powervm. See for example:

commit_message:
Fixing Unit Test Issues and use Train version of Nova

Updating to 1.1.23 version of pypowervm and Fixing UT issues accordingly

NOTE(elod.illes): tox should not test against latest master in stable
branches, so tox.ini is updated to run tests against latest nova from
the correct stable branch.

Change-Id: I7291077407c818c712fb5c98952a15020191a2cc
(cherry picked from commit 1fe310f4be1f6b8f9d2ab1e3a6294566af0cc5e1)

commit_message:
Fix external_validate for Heat resources

External validate use _show_resource to check if Stack resource
exists. Witout entity name and default client name, the validation
will just pass.

Add entity name to `OS::Heat::Stack`
Add entity and default client name to
`OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig` and `OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment`
Story: #1764947
Task: #17359

Change-Id: Ia0864aacf2951c711e99ce2c687f47af421110be

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 10:14:37.000000000', 'message': "Authenticate before Authorization

When user is not logged in and given Dashboard has some `permissions`
defined, `require_perms` decorator was raising `NotAuthorized('You are
not authorized to access %s')` instead of `NotAuthenticated('Please log
in to continue.')`.
This was caused by the order of decorating the views. The decorator
which is applied last is called first in the chain as it wraps the
decorators which were applied before.
This means that to check for authentication before checking permissions
we need to apply the `require_auth` decorator after `require_perms`.

Closes-Bug: 1869708
Change-Id: I94d3fa5c1472bb72c9111cab14c6e05180f88589
(cherry picked from commit e4fd69292c4a8340eba33f5c9d516796472e9269)
"}]
commit_message:
Authenticate before Authorization

When user is not logged in and given Dashboard has some `permissions`
defined, `require_perms` decorator was raising `NotAuthorized('You are
not authorized to access %s')` instead of `NotAuthenticated('Please log
in to continue.')`.
This was caused by the order of decorating the views. The decorator
which is applied last is called first in the chain as it wraps the
decorators which were applied before.
This means that to check for authentication before checking permissions
we need to apply the `require_auth` decorator after `require_perms`.

Closes-Bug: 1869708
Change-Id: I94d3fa5c1472bb72c9111cab14c6e05180f88589
(cherry picked from commit e4fd69292c4a8340eba33f5c9d516796472e9269)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-30 12:00:06.000000000', 'message': 'Bump xstatic-mdi lower-bound

xstatic-mdi 1.4.57.0 seems not to work with horizon.
xstatic-mdi 1.6.50.2 is the latest version for long since the mid of 2016
and most testing is done against 1.6.50.2 including stable branches.
I believe it is safe to upgrade the lower bound of xstatic-mdi.

Change-Id: Idd2e035fa85dfe8c20397d63ed8ae4bd09c84078
'}, {'created': '2020-04-01 07:12:27.000000000', 'message': 'Bump xstatic-mdi lower-bound

xstatic-mdi 1.4.57.0 and 1.6.50.2 have different ways (variables)
to define classes for material design icons.
As a result we need different ways for a workaround like
commit ddc52a7405f0be38629f665d24bcf75022ce0018.
It looks good to support 1.6.50.2 only to simplify the maintenance.
1.6.50.2 was released Feb 2019 and is used in horizon since Stein
release (in upper-constraints), so this change would be not risky.

Change-Id: Idd2e035fa85dfe8c20397d63ed8ae4bd09c84078
'}]
commit_message:
Bump xstatic-mdi lower-bound

xstatic-mdi 1.4.57.0 and 1.6.50.2 have different ways (variables)
to define classes for material design icons.
As a result we need different ways for a workaround like
commit ddc52a7405f0be38629f665d24bcf75022ce0018.
It looks good to support 1.6.50.2 only to simplify the maintenance.
1.6.50.2 was released Feb 2019 and is used in horizon since Stein
release (in upper-constraints), so this change would be not risky.

Change-Id: Idd2e035fa85dfe8c20397d63ed8ae4bd09c84078

commit_message:
Include {{step}} when setting facts

We don't set the fact specific to a step and it seems
to run those puppet tasks for subsequent steps too.

Change-Id: Ic276ea6f34dd638ad66505aa77bddff0e4071ad4
Closes-Bug #1870291
(cherry picked from commit 6db0ac0856b369ee13dc17db7be7ef8c124a8b4b)

[Unity] Cross-arrays storage-assisted migration support

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: Ibb42643faf23bba4a91019b87e7d23e8b36ce1a7

commit_message:
Add juju storage support to the charm

This feature adds juju storage support to the charm.  This is largely to
deal with the related bugs, but also makes the charm more useful.

Release-Note: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/718410/

Related-Bug: #1801349
Change-Id: I056967f4e83f4c99a4aac1090056dd4f320c03f5

subject: Ensure the undercloud output dir constant is consistent
messages: [{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-08 12:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-04-08 12:36:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-04-08 12:58:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-08 12:32:59.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure the undercloud output dir constant is consistent

By default the output directory is the executing users home folder,
however, because this is meant to be user configurable, we need
to modify our constants to respect the users configured information.

This change ensures that the constant UNDERCLOUD_OUTPUT_DIR is consistently
by pre-loading the undercloud configration file when present and pulling
out the `output_dir` option. When this file is not present or the option
is undefined, the constant will use the executing users home folder; the
execting users home folder is the original default.

Related-Bug: #1868619

Change-Id: I94257d1d5ceb2795f5d9596a6a1d5066d881c3b7
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d38c7c329f16e1b9fcc415843639a6b8f4a19f06)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure the undercloud output dir constant is consistent

By default the output directory is the executing users home folder,
however, because this is meant to be user configurable, we need
to modify our constants to respect the users configured information.

This change ensures that the constant UNDERCLOUD_OUTPUT_DIR is consistently
by pre-loading the undercloud configration file when present and pulling
out the `output_dir` option. When this file is not present or the option
is undefined, the constant will use the executing users home folder; the
execting users home folder is the original default.

Related-Bug: #1868619

Change-Id: I94257d1d5ceb2795f5d9596a6a1d5066d881c3b7
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d38c7c329f16e1b9fcc415843639a6b8f4a19f06)

commit_message:
Remove trove firewall rule

We never deploy trove in undercloud, so should remove useless
firewall rule for it to reduce security risk.

Change-Id: I608939ec65ea6217f58cc8ef54039829a07c1382

commit_message:
Add ansible role to Remote system Update FPGA

This change adds ansible role to update RPM packages on
hosts having Intel FPGA accelerator card and to reboot
the board using fpgaflash.

Change-Id: I0514ef22d430839def0d99cab193e20a9f5407fe

commit_message:
Add new default roles in security group policies

This adds new defaults roles in security group API policies.
- GET rules are made granular and default to System or project reader
- add/remove sec grps policies are default to system admin or project member.

Added new context of other_project_reader for system and project reader
policy so that we can verify the other projct with its id not by role.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I83783aa3384d3b667729bbdd4a13fb014176ec75

[{'created': '2020-03-27 08:59:36.000000000', 'message': "partial support for live migration with specific resources

1. Claim allocations from placement first, then claim specific
   resources in Resource Tracker on destination to populate
   migration_context.new_resources
3. cleanup specific resources when live migration succeeds/fails

Because we store specific resources in migration_context during
live migration, to ensure cleanup correctly we can't drop
migration_context before cleanup is complete:
 a) when post live migration, we move source host cleanup before
    destination cleanup(post_live_migration_at_destination will
    apply migration_context and drop it)
 b) when rollback live migration, we drop migration_context after
    rollback operations are complete

For differenct specific resource, we might need driver specific support,
such as vpmem. This change just ensures that new claimed specific
resources are populated to migration_context and migration_context is not
droped before cleanup is complete.

Change-Id: I44ad826f0edb39d770bb3201c675dff78154cbf3
Implements: blueprint support-live-migration-with-virtual-persistent-memory

commit_message:
partial support for live migration with specific resources

1. Claim allocations from placement first, then claim specific
   resources in Resource Tracker on destination to populate
   migration_context.new_resources
3. cleanup specific resources when live migration succeeds/fails

Because we store specific resources in migration_context during
live migration, to ensure cleanup correctly we can't drop
migration_context before cleanup is complete:
 a) when post live migration, we move source host cleanup before
    destination cleanup(post_live_migration_at_destination will
    apply migration_context and drop it)
 b) when rollback live migration, we drop migration_context after
    rollback operations are complete

For different specific resource, we might need driver specific support,
such as vpmem. This change just ensures that new claimed specific
resources are populated to migration_context and migration_context is not
droped before cleanup is complete.

Change-Id: I44ad826f0edb39d770bb3201c675dff78154cbf3
Implements: blueprint support-live-migration-with-virtual-persistent-memory

[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-02 12:27:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-02 12:29:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-02 12:34:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-02 12:35:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-02 12:51:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-03 14:19:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Should we force it and configure a backend? I'm trying to avoid too many options. Is there a use case where we want to disable it? Or change the backend? Why not setting a good backend and move on?"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-04 00:39:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-04 00:44:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Should we force it and configure a backend? I'm trying to avoid too many options.
> Is there a use case where we want to disable it?
> Or change the backend? Why not setting a good backend and move on?

I'm afraid that I was just too afraid of changing the default behavior regarding caching...

I'm confident that current dogpile.cache.memcached is the best option within triplo deployment, and no operators want to use other backends like redis for caching.So we don't really expect somebody want to change the backend, and can drop all parameters.

If they still want to change configuration, they can use ExtraConfig to override it, so I think it doesn't make so big problem, I think."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-04-06 09:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-04-08 18:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2020-04-02 12:27:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add HeatCacheEnabled parameter

Add HeatCacheEnabled parameter, which is set false by default, so that
operators can easily enable caching in heat.

Note that caching in resource finder is disabled even if caching is
enabled, because of known issue with stack recreated with the same
name before cache invalidation.

commit_message:
Enable caching in heat

This patch enables caching in heat with memacached on controller nodes,
to improve perfornance to retrieve informaiton about heat resources.

Note that resource finder cache is still disabled because of known
issue with stack recreated with the same name before cache
invalidation.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715586/
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715573/
Change-Id: If9c0baba6503014919512e758fe20a9a23c6e666

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-06 19:13:49.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround for cinder A/A and etcd with TLS-everywhere

This patch implements a workaround to allow cinder to run in active/
active mode with internal TLS enabled. Cinder uses etcd for its
distributed lock manager, and the LP bug documents several problems
when the deployment enables TLS on the internal API network.

Until a full solution is available, this workaround allows cinder and
etcd to work without TLS. The full solution is complicated, and affects
components outside of tripleo.

Change-Id: Iec0d02f8f51067098dd58beb4fe57a7fd5ab5651
Related-Bug: #1869955
(cherry picked from commit e621ff801bef9d4b04696ad11da06b64080e1352)
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround for cinder A/A and etcd with TLS-everywhere

This patch implements a workaround to allow cinder to run in active/
active mode with internal TLS enabled. Cinder uses etcd for its
distributed lock manager, and the LP bug documents several problems
when the deployment enables TLS on the internal API network.

Until a full solution is available, this workaround allows cinder and
etcd to work without TLS. The full solution is complicated, and affects
components outside of tripleo.

Change-Id: Iec0d02f8f51067098dd58beb4fe57a7fd5ab5651
Related-Bug: #1869955
(cherry picked from commit e621ff801bef9d4b04696ad11da06b64080e1352)

commit_message:
Support for PowerMax Volume Config

PowerMax config options have changed since newton.
Updating them to the latest. Supports both iSCSI and FC
drivers.

Supports deploying multiple instances of the
cinder::backend::dellemc_powermax backend
(e.g. one iscsi + one fc, multiple iscsi, etc.).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708960/
Change-Id: I25be51121390afd7ed3d0f0249733d3ccaf557de
(cherry picked from commit f21f50ce92eca114b171a9d03f6f020cddf4c0de)

commit_message:
Fix incorrect parameter about trove

The parameter $trove should be $trove_enabled.

Change-Id: I34f4d24849fbfbd7f4a810c748621af7b0150f18

[{'created': '2020-04-08 13:09:57.000000000', 'message': 'Added ``bus`` attribute to PhysicalDisks for NVMe drives

This patch adds `bus` attribute to PhysicalDisks so clients
can determine the PCI bus ID of NVMe drives.

Change-Id: I9b6b88826b9902a059e1bf537e51d9f97c9389ba
(cherry picked from commit 719a7d81f8ac4d49bf1fd784665117adc62f676b)
'}]
commit_message:
Added ``bus`` attribute to PhysicalDisks for NVMe drives

This patch adds `bus` attribute to PhysicalDisks so clients
can determine the PCI bus ID of NVMe drives.

Change-Id: I9b6b88826b9902a059e1bf537e51d9f97c9389ba
(cherry picked from commit 719a7d81f8ac4d49bf1fd784665117adc62f676b)

Just to summarize here, gibi, sean-k-mooney and I had a little discussion about this on IRC this morning.

I still fail to see the justification for introducing the PATCH verb to nova's api for this situation, and still would prefer to see PUT used here.

IMHO, from the API user's perspective, they're updating a volume attachment. That's the case for swap and for changing the delete-on-termination flag. The fact that the plumbing behind the scenes is different, depending on what is being changed is of no concern to the client, and could easily change in the future. The job of the API is to abstract those details, and requiring the client to use a different verb because those two things are implemented differently is not appropriate, IMHO. It seems to me that we're just abusing the WSGI framework to make our lives easier by getting it to call a different method in that case.

My preference would be that we continue to use PUT. If the volumeId is changed in the new body, then we need to check for admin authorization (or whatever we require for swap) and do what we do today if authorized. If the volumeId is unchanged, then we authorize for admin-or-owner and honor changes to mutable fields. In this case, only delete-on-termination, but in the future, potentially others. If one is changed, we do the direct update of those and return.

Apparently there is some concern about the three volume ids being out of sync or something, which I don't fully grasp. However, those should only ever be different in the case of swap as they are today, and shouldn't affect the new functionality at all, AFAICT.

I fully understand that PATCH is the easy way out and may simplify some of the code required to implement this, but that is the *wrong* reason to use it, IMHO. The purpose of the API is to abstract operations on resources for the user from the underlying implementation (which could easily change in the future from what it is today). We should not leak details about how these two changes will be handled by requiring a different verb to be used.

I apologize that I didn't review the original spec and that this is coming up relatively late in the process. If it was anything other than the REST API, I'd be more than willing to figure out some merge-now-fix-later alternative. However, the REST API stability is very important to me and we need to get this right the first time, IMHO. I'll be glad to help where I can if need be to accelerate the change."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-03-26 16:00:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

On IRC[1] gmann was also convinced that PUT is OK. 

@Brin: Sorry but it seems that the overall consensus is now towards using the PUT API. We also agreed with Dan that if due to this late change of direction the feature won't be ready until Feature Freeze (in two weeks) then we are willing to give some extra time to finish it up before the release.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2020-03-26.log.html#t2020-03-26T15:33:23"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-03-26 16:36:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

commit_message:
Allow PUT volume attachments API to modify delete_on_termination

Allow PUT /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments/{volume_id}``
to support specifying ``delete_on_termination`` field in the request
body. This allows updating the attached volume's flag that controls
whether or not it is automatically deleted when the instance is deleted.

When we request 'volumeId' and 'delete_on_termination' in the requst
body to swap volume, since the new microversion it will be support
updating the swapping volume's delete flag.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>

Blueprint: destroy-instance-with-datavolume
Change-Id: I6ccac4e17f56b40e67c79d40f32558ef414685ea

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-30 21:10:09.000000000', 'message': 'RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic

This patch fixes a bug in volume cloning where the source volume is
prematurely closed.  If the destination volume requires flattening and
an exception occurs during flattening, the code attempts to perform
cleanup operations on an already closed volume.  This resulted in a
segmentation fault which causes cinder to restart.

Co-authored-by: Jon Bernard <jobernar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib713aa91b775d8ec07ffdb24dfe1db1b6ecf2921
Closes-Bug: #1794956
(cherry picked from commit 394fbd7e20dbd8fb8cc58510657753432c43fa9b)
(cherry picked from commit 7bfd3c4dcf528ba900d6179ff06c227ea1016176)
(cherry picked from commit 47caae4cbbcacf1d81554af4ea2bfec01a0f7c54)
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic

This patch fixes a bug in volume cloning where the source volume is
prematurely closed.  If the destination volume requires flattening and
an exception occurs during flattening, the code attempts to perform
cleanup operations on an already closed volume.  This resulted in a
segmentation fault which causes cinder to restart.

Co-authored-by: Jon Bernard <jobernar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib713aa91b775d8ec07ffdb24dfe1db1b6ecf2921
Closes-Bug: #1794956
(cherry picked from commit 394fbd7e20dbd8fb8cc58510657753432c43fa9b)
(cherry picked from commit 7bfd3c4dcf528ba900d6179ff06c227ea1016176)
(cherry picked from commit 47caae4cbbcacf1d81554af4ea2bfec01a0f7c54)

commit_message:
Remove undefined octavia::rabbit_password from default hieradata

puppet-octavia doesn't provide the octavia::rabbit_password parameter,
so it should be removed from default hieradata used in unit tests.

Change-Id: I78a7a386fc0fc99cbfc787e7eab2798269c02217

I need some time to dig into this and understand it. It's an area of Taskflow I have not spent much time with."}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-04-19 11:26:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-04-24 01:15:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-05-07 10:56:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-05-07 10:59:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-05-07 13:02:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-05-08 11:12:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-05-14 12:56:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-05-14 12:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Switched PoC(patch set 2) to use redis and face an issue - jobs are not resumed properly as with zookeper. Will investigate this more.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-05-15 16:01:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-05-16 11:52:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-05-16 12:19:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Current patch set is more or less working variant of implementation with redis backend.
Issue with redis is that by default redis does not expiry jobs, so the jobs are not resumed after restart of worker. https://github.com/openstack/taskflow/blob/master/taskflow/jobs/backends/impl_redis.py#L248-L254
This change extends claim method, so job can be expired and adds a listener for tasks and flows to extend_expity while job is working under these tasks.

The issue I see here -  during creation of loadbalancer, while we are trying to connect to amphora - tasks, flows are not triggered and if it takes a long time - another worker may start working on job in parallel. 

To solve this we have to rework AmphoraComputeConnectivityWait, so that task got triggered with each try (need inverstigation). Another option is to  set very long expiry time - which is not good as resuming jobs will take a lot of time then.

Anotherwise, we have to use zookeper as its client is more advanced and handles these situations by default.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-05-17 10:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-05-20 13:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-05-22 08:35:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-05-22 08:49:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-05-22 10:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Published edit on patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-06-06 13:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Patch Set 14 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-07-05 16:37:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

I know this is heavily WIP, but left a few questions anyway.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-07-08 08:14:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(3 comments)

All reviews are highly appreciated! 
I will update this change as soon as I have working amphora and loadbalancer flows transitioned from db obj to dicts.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-07-24 13:00:37.000000000', 'content': Ann,

I had an issue while running this patch with spare amphora enabled (spare_amphora_pool_size = 1 in octavia.conf), house-keeping service keeps spawning an amphora every 30 seconds until one of them is READY.

It seems that this line: https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/src/branch/master/octavia/controller/housekeeping/house_keeping.py#L97-L98 no longer waits for the boot to be finished.

I don't know the best method to fix that, but maybe amp_repo.get_spare_amphora_count() could include amphorae in BOOTING state, it would avoid to spawn amphora when one is booting."}, {'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2020-02-11 15:06:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 88:

> I don't know the best method to fix that, but maybe
 > amp_repo.get_spare_amphora_count() could include amphorae in
 > BOOTING state, it would avoid to spawn amphora when one is booting.

or perhaps can ControllerWorker.create_amphora() be blocking?"}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2020-02-11 15:20:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 88:

Gregory thanks for review!
Strange that I didn't notice this before - I was able to reproduce it on my devstack now.

The logic of jobboard is a bit different as job are posted to it and then conductor organize claim of worker to start working on it. So, yes for amphorav2 create_amphora is finished when job is just posted, not really finished. Will check what can be done."}, {'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2020-02-12 07:30:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 88:

I got a similar issues with ControllerWorker._perform_amphora_failover() because it is no longer blocking:

- during an amphora failover (https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/src/branch/master/octavia/controller/worker/v2/controller_worker.py#L913-L920), status is set to ACTIVE but failover is not finished.
- during a loadbalancer failover (https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/src/branch/master/octavia/controller/worker/v2/controller_worker.py#L953-L965), failover is performed simultaneously on both amphorae (in ACTIVE_STANDBY) while it should be done sequentially, and ACTIVE status is set before amphora failover is completed.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2020-02-12 09:06:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 88:

I added issue that you discovered on https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/octavia-worker-v2-issue-tracker'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2020-02-12 10:57:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 89.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2020-02-12 11:00:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 89:

Gregory, thanks a lot for discovering these issues!
In the 89th patch set I introduce wait_for_job logic, so issue should be resolved.'}, {'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2020-02-12 13:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 89:

 > In the 89th patch set I introduce wait_for_job logic, so issue

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-25 11:59:21.000000000', 'message': '[WIP]PoC Octavia taskflow persistence

Current change is more like checking what should be
done to start using taskflow persistence and jobboad
in Octavia on example of create/update/delete loadbalancer
scenarious.

The widest required changes - start passing
dictionaries instead of database model objects
in flows and tasks, so they can be stored in persistence
backend and then loaded from there.

Story: 2005072
Task: 29645

Change-Id: I92ee4e879e98e4718d2e9aba56486341223a9157
'}, {'created': '2019-04-19 11:26:09.000000000', 'message': '[WIP]PoC Octavia taskflow persistence

done to start using taskflow persistence and jobboad
in Octavia on example of create/update/delete loadbalancer
scenarious.

The widest required changes - start passing
dictionaries instead of database model objects
in flows and tasks, so they can be stored in persistence
backend and then loaded from there.

Story: 2005072
Task: 29645

Change-Id: I92ee4e879e98e4718d2e9aba56486341223a9157
'}, {'created': '2019-10-16 12:09:57.000000000', 'message': 'Jobboard based controller

Introduce TaskFlowServiceController which uses taskflow
jobboard feature and saves jobs info into persistence backend.

Jobboard could be operated via RedisTaskFlowDriver or
ZookeeperTaskFlowDriver, that could be set via the config.
RedisTaskFlowDriver is intoduced as default backend for jobboard.
Usage of jobboard allows to resume jobs in case of restart/stop
of Octavia controller services.

Persistence backend saves state of flow tasks that required in
case of resuming job. SQLAlchemy backend is used here.

Story: 2005072
Task: 30806

Change-Id: I92ee4e879e98e4718d2e9aba56486341223a9157
'}, {'created': '2019-12-26 12:14:15.000000000', 'message': 'Jobboard based controller

Introduce TaskFlowServiceController which uses taskflow
jobboard feature and saves jobs info into persistence backend.

Jobboard could be operated via RedisTaskFlowDriver or
ZookeeperTaskFlowDriver, that could be set via the config.
RedisTaskFlowDriver is intoduced as default backend for jobboard.
Usage of jobboard allows to resume jobs in case of restart/stop
of Octavia controller services.

Persistence backend saves state of flow tasks that required in
case of resuming job. SQLAlchemy backend is used here.

Bump taskflow version to 3.7.1 and add dependency to
SQLAlchemy-Utils (required for taskflow sqlalchemy
backend support).

Story: 2005072
Task: 30806
Task: 30816

Change-Id: I92ee4e879e98e4718d2e9aba56486341223a9157

commit_message:
Jobboard based controller

Introduce TaskFlowServiceController which uses taskflow
jobboard feature and saves jobs info into persistence backend.

Jobboard could be operated via RedisTaskFlowDriver or
ZookeeperTaskFlowDriver, that could be set via the config.
RedisTaskFlowDriver is intoduced as default backend for jobboard.
Usage of jobboard allows to resume jobs in case of restart/stop
of Octavia controller services.

Persistence backend saves state of flow tasks that required in
case of resuming job. SQLAlchemy backend is used here.

Bump taskflow version to 3.7.1 and add dependency to
SQLAlchemy-Utils (required for taskflow sqlalchemy
backend support).

Story: 2005072
Task: 30806
Task: 30816
Task: 30817

Change-Id: I92ee4e879e98e4718d2e9aba56486341223a9157

commit_message:
Reduce osh-infra check jobs

This change moves the following non-voting checks to experimental:

  - openstack-helm-infra-federated-monitoring
  - openstack-helm-infra-kafka
  - openstack-helm-infra-local-storage
  - openstack-helm-infra-aio-network-policy
  - openstack-helm-infra-apparmor
  - openstack-helm-infra-aio-logging-apparmor
  - openstack-helm-infra-openstack-support-apparmor
  - openstack-helm-infra-metacontroller

Change-Id: I6bb70be0dc1b012742405818d049e9d0e155f671
