commit_message:
Allow INSPECTWAIT state for lookup

this is in fact a valid state to receve lookup request from node being
booted when an asyncronous inspect driver interface is used.

Change-Id: Ida44a25a0f76523e22dbdb82878b440e62823167

subject: Identify voting bots
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1004, 'name': 'Mohammed Naser', 'email': 'mnaser@vexxhost.com', 'username': 'mnaser'}, {'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos GonÃ§alves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-09-19 04:29:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-09-19 04:31:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Note that it's not really possible to do anything even if we identify these bots, but we've also noticed that the backport field is useless now as all of our patches blindly get +1s in it. This way they'll just vote in the bot field and leave the backport field available for real use."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-09-19 04:32:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

lol
Example: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682171/'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-09-19 04:45:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

you need to sort properly'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-09-19 05:39:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-09-19 06:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-09-19 08:18:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

That is an interesting experiment indeed.

Not sure what we'll do with the data though."}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2019-09-19 11:37:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

The infra channel mentioned wanting a TC perspective on this. With my TC hat on, this is fine with me (though I don't speak for others)."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-09-19 12:09:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I will be curious to see the results.

What is expected from the TC, an attentive eye, sharing the experiment with other ptls, "none of the above"?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-09-19 13:26:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

JP, I just wanted to give a heads up since this is change highlights a community "mis-pattern" with an interesting solution. Nothing expected besides - +1s/-1s as usual welcome.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-09-19 14:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This may sound fun but what if these votes are actually not made by bots, but possibly by people with little knowledge of english language? Tricking them into submitting an "I am a bot" statement might be offensive.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-09-19 18:42:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So, this comes on the heels of our last new field, Backport-Candidate. We saw some interesting behavior with it sorting first before the normal review field. It is true that I saw some people accidentally vote on that instead of Code-Review reflexively (and there was at least once where *I* did it by accident), but it was always very quickly fixed. If people vote in it, we can talk to them and try to get them to change their vote and explain the issue -- but we're also not doing anything directly with this data (no bans or anything). The *primary* purpose at the moment is really to clean up the Backport field so it can actually be useful for filtering, and this just happened to be an interesting way to do it."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-09-20 06:40:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I agree. The backport field has worked out super well for us, but has had some "unusual" votes. I don't find catching bots any more embarrassing than voting +1 with no comment or feedback. In the age of wechat and google translate I struggle that someone would accidentally use the bot vote based on a language issue. Frankly, they are mostly over worked folks that are tired and mis-click, only to fix it the day after (self included). I agree that since this is not "actionable", i.e. we are not banning folks, but more of an experiment, I am ok with it.  If anything, I would send a private e-mail using Doug's exceptional template e-mail encouraging them to participate and describing how we use votes.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-09-20 14:07:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> I agree. The backport field has worked out super well for us, but
 > has had some "unusual" votes. I don't find catching bots any more
 > embarrassing than voting +1 with no comment or feedback. In the age
 > of wechat and google translate I struggle that someone would
 > accidentally use the bot vote based on a language issue. Frankly,
 > they are mostly over worked folks that are tired and mis-click,
 > only to fix it the day after (self included). I agree that since
 > this is not "actionable", i.e. we are not banning folks, but more
 > of an experiment, I am ok with it.  If anything, I would send a
 > private e-mail using Doug's exceptional template e-mail encouraging
 > them to participate and describing how we use votes.

Where is that email by any chance? It would be nice to have it in the tips and tricks for PTL and/or documented somewhere.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-09-20 14:07:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-09-30 20:29:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

So, can we do this?'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-10-01 06:51:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> So, can we do this?

Nobody formally opposed to this, and we brought it up in our channel. http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-tc/%23openstack-tc.2019-09-19.log.html#t2019-09-19T08:21:11 . I think the approach we took in the past, and that we would prefer continuing, is engage with the people and companies doing these wrong reviews, and improve the quality of their reviews.

As long as we are keeping a soft and gentle approach when talking to the people caught by results of this experiment, everything is fine.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-10-02 14:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-10-02 14:14:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm fine trying this experiment - please engage with those folks."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-10-03 16:57:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

with my infra hat on, change is ok, with my tc hat on, i think this is just trying to find targets and "ha told you so"

we can do better by reaching out to people.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-10-03 17:56:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

Alternative: Change "Backport-Candidate" to "Stable-Backport-Candidate", that way review stays first.

Removing +2 due to -1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-10-07 19:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

changing the order will avoid polluting the backport field.

We all knew some "robots", there are other means to contact them - I would rather ignore them. With changing the order, you can better ignore them...'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-10-07 21:41:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

What Andreas says is correct, and is the main motivation. I don't think any member of our team is expecting to go taunting people -- at most we might gently nudge folks if they use the wrong field. I admit the field name is a bit cutesy, but I don't see it as a big problem or I wouldn't have proposed it."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-03-24 17:41:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Adam, want to change the order of the entries - or abandon?'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-04-08 23:44:02.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I'd rather have the backport field be polluted and be able to identify voting-bots that way, than reorganize the fields and have the bots back in action. It's not as clean as doing this, but it's true that we can just contact people directly when we see it as a mistake."}]

commit_message:
Identify voting bots

Since adding the backport-candidate option, we've noticed a lot of what
can only be "voting bots" giving +1 in that field (it is now sorted
first) instead of giving +1 on the code review field. This leads us to
believe that the bots are not especially well written, and will simply
vote +1 in the first field they see. This should be a fun experiment. :)

Change-Id: I4c35cd261a5bd49e96f6021162cac2add711fc73

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python-jobs, ussuri-jobs is enough
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Remove html_last_updated_fmt from conf.py since it's set
  by newer openstackdocstheme, update requirement of openstackdocstheme.

Change-Id: I13f089de86ce3eb30770c91ee5372652e40fb52b

commit_message:
Let flavors override amp AZ/boot_network

Putting these two together because they most likely both need to be set
together to function (since different AZs usually plug to different
networks). Note that the control-plane must be able to route to any
network used as a boot (management) network.

Change-Id: I7900b0e282cdf521da1ee62d48b190aea872be95

This is clearly a Nova bug and not something we should change. We are properly calling the nova APIs. If they are not honoring those calls it is a bug in their code.
I have opened: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1863190'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-04-08 23:31:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Yeah this is gross, but with pack mode enabled in nova, soft-anti-affinity will never work on creates (just an FYI).'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-21 15:42:21.000000000', 'message': 'Amp create should be linear with anti-affinity

If we use an unordered flow for ACTIVE_STANDBY amp creates and
anti-affinity is enabled, nova will not be able to properly schedule,
and probably will require a reschedule (which is not always enabled) due
to the two amps having a friendly scheduling race.
Using ordered flow is slightly slower, but is the only way to guarantee
the scheduler will be able to pick correctly for the second amp.

Change-Id: I4d20274d30eff8b02508bde09c5d76c27d64467a
'}]
commit_message:
Amp create should be linear with anti-affinity

If we use an unordered flow for ACTIVE_STANDBY amp creates and
anti-affinity is enabled, nova will not be able to properly schedule,
and probably will require a reschedule (which is not always enabled) due
to the two amps having a friendly scheduling race.
Using ordered flow is slightly slower, but is the only way to guarantee
the scheduler will be able to pick correctly for the second amp.

Change-Id: I4d20274d30eff8b02508bde09c5d76c27d64467a

subject: Conf option to use VIP ip as source ip for backend
messages:
[{'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-01-14 21:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-01-14 21:24:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-01-15 11:11:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-01-17 18:45:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Looks good from a code perspective, don't know if there was a story to link in the commit message."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-01-17 18:45:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2020-01-23 13:59:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Code looks good to me, my only concern is about using member's subnet, I find weird that setting a subnet for a member has an impact on the source ip of connections."}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2020-01-24 07:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-01-24 21:26:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-02-03 18:14:29.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to az-tweaks'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-02-03 18:14:56.000000000', 'content': 'Topic az-tweaks removed'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-02-03 18:15:15.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to source-ip-backend'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-02-25 01:31:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-02-28 05:03:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

So, this actually does have an issue, as I've discovered in my cloud (where it is already deployed):

In ACTIVE_STANDBY topology, we will now configured both amps to source traffic to members from the VIP address. Unfortunately, the VIP address isn't actually bound on the BACKUP amp, so if a healthcheck is configured, it will fail like this:

Feb 25 06:34:29 3b730559 haproxy[2027]: Server db88aed9-4ef9-4a70-9e74-32ec4b070b78:9bfe7376-c83a-41d0-8bc4-ac837a531a7a/5a598c80-1860-418f-8067-88fee0fcd93e is DOWN, reason: Layer4 connection problem, info: "General socket error (Invalid argument)", check duration: 0ms. 1 active and 0 backup servers left. 0 sessions active, 0 requeued, 0 remaining in queue.

The ramifications of this are twofold:

1) The messages sent back to the health-manager show the members as ONLINE for the ACTIVE amp, but ERROR for the BACKUP. This creates an update race, which often ends with the status reporting as ERROR for those members in the API.

2) In a failover scenario, the BACKUP will have all members DOWN for (checkdelay*rise) seconds, since the members won't be marked healthy until healthchecks pass $rise times after the VIP is brought up on that amp.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-03-30 23:04:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

Yeah, I don't know if there is a way to fix this architecturally. May have to call it a dead idea."}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-04-08 23:30:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Conf option to use VIP ip as source ip for backend

Add [haproxy_amphora] use_vip_as_source_ip boolean option.
When set to True, haproxy will use the VIP address when connecting to
members. If a member has a subnet provided, this option will be
ignored for that member.

Change-Id: I37112e3557e248b44186934ed07d82fa31ed48f5

commit_message:
Fix gunicorn name on Py3@CentOS7 in devstack

On non-Ubuntu systems, when gunicorn is pip-installed on Py3,
command name remains `gunicorn` rather than `gunicorn3`.

Change-Id: I5b8cb974d900bd3bdf7ec08adb3e6586494a26a2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-06 11:45:18.000000000', 'message': 'Do not link up HA router gateway in backup node

L3 router will set its devices link up by default.
For HA routers, the gateway device will be pluged
in all scheduled hosts. When the gateway deivce is
up in backup node, it will send out IPv6 related
packets (MLDv2) according to some kernal config.
This will cause the physical fabric think that the
gateway MAC is now working in the backup node. And
finally the master node L3 traffic will be broken.

This patch sets the backup gateway device link down
by default. When the VRRP sets the master state in
one host, the L3 agent state change procedure will
do link up action for the gateway device.

Closes-Bug: #1859832
Change-Id: I8dca2c1a2f8cb467cfb44420f0eea54ca0932b05
(cherry picked from commit c52029c39aa824a67095fbbf9e59eff769d92587)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not link up HA router gateway in backup node

L3 router will set its devices link up by default.
For HA routers, the gateway device will be pluged
in all scheduled hosts. When the gateway deivce is
up in backup node, it will send out IPv6 related
packets (MLDv2) according to some kernal config.
This will cause the physical fabric think that the
gateway MAC is now working in the backup node. And
finally the master node L3 traffic will be broken.

This patch sets the backup gateway device link down
by default. When the VRRP sets the master state in
one host, the L3 agent state change procedure will
do link up action for the gateway device.

Closes-Bug: #1859832
Change-Id: I8dca2c1a2f8cb467cfb44420f0eea54ca0932b05
(cherry picked from commit c52029c39aa824a67095fbbf9e59eff769d92587)

However, I'm wondering what we need to do with backports. If we also add an exclusion here it will conflict with the global requirements (this exclusion is not there for stable/train) and most likely with the stable policy. Although, about stable policy I'm not sure, because this is only for the doc CI job. Any ideas about how to best proceed? Without this exclusion the doc job fails."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-08 11:29:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-08 10:20:12.000000000', 'message': "Add YAQL sanitizing for iterators

* This patch also adds handling for iterators in the sanitizing
  function for YAQL results. JSON serialization for iterators now
  works correctly but the issue is that they can be used only once.
  So, for example, if we got a result from YAQL and performed JSON
  serialization for it, then the iterator is already empty and
  the data structure is just corrupted. So we can't further pass
  to executors and other subsystems. The solution is just to sanitize
  iterators after they're just returned from YAQL.
* Added a test to make sure that action input reaches an executor
  not corrupted, although it gets saved into DB and hence serialized
  into JSON.
* Changed the Sphinx entry in requirements.txt so that the version
  3.0.0 is now excluded (it breaks the build).

Closes-Bug: #1871567
Change-Id: I47abe0904b49d72e33eb10080c71fb81980d44da

commit_message:
Add YAQL sanitizing for iterators

* This patch also adds handling for iterators in the sanitizing
  function for YAQL results. JSON serialization for iterators now
  works correctly but the issue is that they can be used only once.
  So, for example, if we got a result from YAQL and performed JSON
  serialization for it, then the iterator is already empty and
  the data structure is just corrupted. So we can't further pass
  to executors and other subsystems. The solution is just to sanitize
  iterators after they're just returned from YAQL.
* Added a test to make sure that action input reaches an executor
  not corrupted, although it gets saved into DB and hence serialized
  into JSON.
* Changed the Sphinx entry in requirements.txt so that the version
  3.0.0 is now excluded (it breaks the build).

Closes-Bug: #1871567
Change-Id: I47abe0904b49d72e33eb10080c71fb81980d44da

[{'created': '2020-04-08 18:28:38.000000000', 'message': "Sensu: Remove ceph and process-checks plugins from client

The sensu image became unbuildable, failing to install the ceph plugin:

    Unable to resolve dependencies: sensu-plugins-ceph requires english (= 0.6.3)

This has happened because the author of the 'english' gem has seen fit
to publish a new 0.7.0 release, and 'yank' [1] all previous releases
from rubygems.

This change removes the ceph and process-checks plugins, which both
suffer from a dependency on the yanked english 0.6.3.

[1] https://rubygems.org/gems/english/versions/0.6.3

Change-Id: I9d34413fa10b5a2920aca60b08141bfaddcc7415
Closes-Bug: #1871600
(cherry picked from commit 818dc4d6ff12a3119be072e0c68e2d2c8da9b799)
"}]
commit_message:
Sensu: Remove ceph and process-checks plugins from client

The sensu image became unbuildable, failing to install the ceph plugin:

    Unable to resolve dependencies: sensu-plugins-ceph requires english (= 0.6.3)

This has happened because the author of the 'english' gem has seen fit
to publish a new 0.7.0 release, and 'yank' [1] all previous releases
from rubygems.

This change removes the ceph and process-checks plugins, which both
suffer from a dependency on the yanked english 0.6.3.

[1] https://rubygems.org/gems/english/versions/0.6.3

Change-Id: I9d34413fa10b5a2920aca60b08141bfaddcc7415
Closes-Bug: #1871600
(cherry picked from commit 818dc4d6ff12a3119be072e0c68e2d2c8da9b799)

<smcginnis> stephenfin: Yes, but it will apply to oslo.policy for victoria at this point.

<stephenfin> sweet"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-04-08 21:02:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> <stephenfin> smcginnis: Another release'y question- it's okay to
 > bump lower-constraints post feature freeze, yes? https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717892/
 > <smcginnis> stephenfin: Yes, but it will apply to oslo.policy for
 > victoria at this point.
 > <stephenfin> ah, since we'll branch from the last release?
 > <smcginnis> Yep.
 > <stephenfin> sweet

I just want to follow up on this because I think it sets a bad precedent. We don't want to merge patches like this post-feature freeze because then if we happen to need another release of this library to fix a bug found at the last minute, this will get pulled in. It's particularly relevant in this library because we have just such a situation where Nova needs a new feature in order to address their log bloat, and now we have this unrelated version bump that will be included too.

It should be fine since it's just a lower-constraints bump this time, but in general we shouldn't be merging feature changes after feature freeze."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-08 21:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

 > time, but in general we shouldn't be merging feature changes after

Ah, sorry. I realize now that we actually didn't follow through with all of the steps for the oslo freeze. Really, those "final" release requests should have also included the stable/ussuri branch creation. If that would have been done, then that would have freed master up to continue on with victoria development with very little need to stop or slow things down.

commit_message:
Bump oslo.utils to 3.40.0

Because the bug #1804528 has been fixed in oslo.utils,
we need to add an explicit dependency on oslo.utils to
support removing "the conversion to dict" code snippet in
oslo.policy.For more details please refer to
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717191

Change-Id: I4eb614dcb194d4f2668ba2259e624f850e0f1dfd

suffer from a dependency on the yanked english 0.6.3.

[1] https://rubygems.org/gems/english/versions/0.6.3

Change-Id: I9d34413fa10b5a2920aca60b08141bfaddcc7415
Closes-Bug: #1871600
(cherry picked from commit 818dc4d6ff12a3119be072e0c68e2d2c8da9b799)
"}]
commit_message:
Sensu: Remove ceph and process-checks plugins from client

The sensu image became unbuildable, failing to install the ceph plugin:

    Unable to resolve dependencies: sensu-plugins-ceph requires english (= 0.6.3)

This has happened because the author of the 'english' gem has seen fit
to publish a new 0.7.0 release, and 'yank' [1] all previous releases
from rubygems.

This change removes the ceph and process-checks plugins, which both
suffer from a dependency on the yanked english 0.6.3.

[1] https://rubygems.org/gems/english/versions/0.6.3

Change-Id: I9d34413fa10b5a2920aca60b08141bfaddcc7415
Closes-Bug: #1871600
(cherry picked from commit 818dc4d6ff12a3119be072e0c68e2d2c8da9b799)

commit_message:
Fix branch to series matching logic in job updates

Missed in Id58f439052b4ea6b092b87682576a746433dcc27 that the branch name
passed in when determining the next series name will be of the form
'stable/series', resulting in not finding the next name and job update
logic being skipped. This adjusts the branch name to properly match the
series name.

Change-Id: Ie4102ceb0d12b7d98919ddb89b8e17df1859fa6a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

In Ussuri, nova is hoping to implement support for extra spec
validation. If or when this is completed, only extra specs that are
recognised will be permitted by default. We're currently using a number
of arbitrary extra specs to validate the 'os-extra_specs' API meaning we
will fall afoul of this validation. Head the issue off now by using
recognized extra specs, namely 'hw:numa_nodes' and 'hw:cpu_policy',
instead.

Change-Id: I95a1050d6a5e2e40793ae7f18ff0d326455b4b36
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-02-12 10:01:12.000000000', 'message': "compute: Use valid extra specs to test 'os-extra_specs' API

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
compute: Use valid extra specs to test 'os-extra_specs' API

In Ussuri, nova is hoping to implement support for extra spec
validation. If or when this is completed, only extra specs that are
recognised will be permitted by default. We're currently using a number
of arbitrary extra specs to validate the 'os-extra_specs' API meaning we
will fall afoul of this validation. Head the issue off now by using
recognized extra specs, namely 'hw:numa_nodes' and 'hw:cpu_policy',
instead.

Change-Id: I95a1050d6a5e2e40793ae7f18ff0d326455b4b36
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib75615f7a7bc035333003b281251de2a00bd92f1

commit_message:
sensu: mark as unbuildable for both binary and source

INFO:kolla.common.utils.sensu-client:[SENSU-INSTALL] installing Sensu gem 'sensu-plugins-ceph:~>1'
INFO:kolla.common.utils.sensu-client:ERROR:  Could not find a valid gem 'english' (= 0.6.3) in any repository

Authors of 'english' Ruby gem believe that only latest (0.7.0 at the
moment) version should be available. So until sensu authors update their
dependencies sensu images are not buildable for us.

All distro/architecture/install type are affected.

Change-Id: I0297c07f3ab61e1cd5a5fc34265e01e17ab6d88c

commit_message:
Pass --all-stores, --allow-failure as bool to API

Newly added command line options --all-stores, --allow-failure are boolean
but we are passing it as a string to glance API. This will cause problem if
those parameters are not converted to boolean at API side.

Passing these parameters as boolean instead of string to API.

Change-Id: I8d4eab9241fc9bb24bc40b47bf18d63c86a97d77
Closes-Bug: #1871674

commit_message:
Add ability to specify TLS cipher list for pools

Pools can now be each be assigned an OpenSSL cipher string with the
field tls_ciphers.  A new configuration option, default_pool_ciphers,
specifies what cipher string to use for new tls-enabled pools
if one is not explicitly specified at time of creation.

Change-Id: Iedb7774bfb8d70ea307d6a513248e1fe2389fa34
Depends-On: I77da6f14063877af0077f2c12df1aab5d5ead187
Story: 2006627
Task: 37172

commit_message:
Fix multiple CI failures

1. Install python-openstackclient using upper constraints

Detect current branch from .gitreview and use upper constraints to
install python-openstackclient, to guarantee compatibility with the
Python version in use.

(cherry picked from commit ef33e6ecb770f852bb4433d6b0d2dec7778937a4)

2. Use tenks stable/1.0 for Python 2 support

Tenks dropped Python 2 compatibility in its master branch. Use Tenks
stable/1.0 for CentOS 7 jobs.

Change-Id: Ie44508fe3d3b08190afa5a43748e43548a63ff82
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/718424

commit_message:
Don't let an Exception in one event affect others

A RowEvent that is added that raises an exception from matches()
would cause the loop to abort that checks whether that event
matches successive RowEvents. Since it is fairly common in UPDATE
events to want to check old.column != row.column etc. to test
whether a RowEvent should fire and 'old' only contains columns that
have been modified, it seems reasonable to treat Exceptions as
"not matching" and to debug log enough info in case there was an
unintended error.

Change-Id: I0cda6044ee7652350369ff4d5d2b0ab8289c127e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 16:37:44.000000000', 'message': "Exclude /var/lib/ironic/* from container-puppet.sh rsync

Exclude /var/lib/ironic/* from container-puppet.sh rsync, this is a
leftover from the initial containerization of TripleO; now we have
host prep tasks, the ironic conductor and inspector bind mount
/var/lib/ironic and generate the data that they need. But this data should
not be in the config volume or it can conflict from each other when rsync
runs at the same time.

TripleO upgrade tasks and host prep tasks will take care of removing
the var directory from the config volumes and the containers will just use
the bind mount, like it should be doing now.
These tasks will run during a minor update, major upgrade, and fast
forward upgrade.

Note: this will have to be backported to stable/train, and cleaned up
later after Ussuri as the tasks won't be needed anymore.

Root cause patches:
- I3a195466a5039e7641e843c11e5436440bfc5a01
- Ibcff99f03e6751fbf3197adefd5d344178b71fc2

Related-Bug: #1868934
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I69a1d1059bdfc0b99cf6a4a3dc78a1eb9a43ad0b

commit_message:
Exclude /var/lib/ironic/* from container-puppet.sh rsync

Exclude /var/lib/ironic/* from container-puppet.sh rsync, this is a
leftover from the initial containerization of TripleO; now we have
host prep tasks, the ironic conductor and inspector bind mount
/var/lib/ironic and generate the data that they need. But this data should
not be in the config volume or it can conflict from each other when rsync
runs at the same time.

TripleO upgrade tasks and host prep tasks will take care of removing
the var directory from the config volumes and the containers will just use
the bind mount, like it should be doing now.
These tasks will run during a minor update, major upgrade, and fast
forward upgrade.

Note: this will have to be backported to stable/train, and cleaned up
later after Ussuri as the tasks won't be needed anymore.

Root cause patches:
- I3a195466a5039e7641e843c11e5436440bfc5a01
- Ibcff99f03e6751fbf3197adefd5d344178b71fc2

Related-Bug: #1868934
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I69a1d1059bdfc0b99cf6a4a3dc78a1eb9a43ad0b

commit_message:
Stop iterating on first matching QoS rule

Instead of creating a list of all matching rules and returning the
first one, iterate only until we find the first matching rule.

Related-Bug: 1871104
Change-Id: I24c2f1adc17aa02fe1042834d08fd23719a50fd8

commit_message:
Fix multistack inventory

The static inventory merging was setting the role hosts to the _meta hostvars.
This is a special key to set hostvars for dynamic inventories. It contains all
hosts in the inventory to prevent the dynamic inventory script being called
with --host for each host.

It was not used by the single stack inventory when generating a static
inventory. Instead an evil magic flag (host_format_dict), switched the
behaviour to embed the hostvars.

This flag is now removed and replaced with a param to the list method and
calling the write_static_inventory methods no longer magically mutates
the object. The logic for static vs dynamic inventory should be clearer.

The interface for the multi stack inventory has also change to be more
consistent with the single stack interface.

Unit tests now cover both static and dynamic multistack inventories.

Change-Id: Ife14dbe04dd11db44a944f98373f63e01dfbb8d8
Depends-On: If022a4647aaebc4b212bba188cc959ff2f8f9311
Closes-bug: #1849073

Log messages like:

ChassisGatewayAgentEvent : Matched Chassis, create, None None

are not particularly useful. This adds a default repr to RowEvents
and also a Row stringifier (which eventually could go in the ovs
lib). Subclasses of RowEvent that rely on custom match functions
should write their own __repr__ methods.

commit_message:
Make Event logging more useful by default

Log messages like:

ChassisGatewayAgentEvent : Matched Chassis, create, None None

are not particularly useful. This adds a default repr to RowEvents
and also a Row stringifier (which eventually could go in the ovs
lib). Subclasses of RowEvent that rely on custom match functions
should write their own __repr__ methods.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717264/
Change-Id: Ice22858df465b37b973718be718673aab46193ce
(cherry picked from commit ceea8a23f1e113d46da8b62ecf1cb77acbee24a4)

Also TRIPLEO_PLAN_NAME did not work for comma seperated list.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-06 09:13:01.000000000', 'message': "Stop assuming a specific inventory structure

It's not safe to assume the ansible inventory follows a particular
structure e.g that overcloud group contains children or role groups
contain hosts

Instead use jinja filters from tripleo-ansible to flatten the inventory
to group->host mapping and list the tripleo role, regardless of the
parent/child group relationships.

Depends-On: I8a47c945656558a0d3baa67a5547f0d859f8c816
Change-Id: If022a4647aaebc4b212bba188cc959ff2f8f9311
"}]
commit_message:
Stop assuming a specific inventory structure

It's not safe to assume the ansible inventory follows a particular
structure e.g that overcloud group contains children or role groups
contain hosts

Instead use jinja filters from tripleo-ansible to flatten the inventory
to group->host mapping and list the tripleo role, regardless of the
parent/child group relationships.

Depends-On: I8a47c945656558a0d3baa67a5547f0d859f8c816
Change-Id: If022a4647aaebc4b212bba188cc959ff2f8f9311

[{'created': '2020-02-10 14:50:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add node lessee field

This change adds a `lessee` field to nodes, and exposes it
to policy. It also updates the non-admin node list API
to match for both owner and lessee; and updates the
allocation conductor to match owner allocations with nodes
with the appropriate lessee.

Change-Id: Ib31b49c7143ec8fd6cb486fc24038215b197c418
Story: 2006506
Task: 37930

commit_message:
Add node lessee field

This change adds a `lessee` field to nodes, and exposes it
to policy. It also updates the non-admin node list API
to match for both owner and lessee; and updates the
allocation conductor to match owner allocations with nodes
with the appropriate lessee.

Change-Id: Ib31b49c7143ec8fd6cb486fc24038215b197c418
Story: 2006506
Task: 37930

commit_message:
Cleanup os_region_name in cinder backend

The os_region_name parameter in glance::backend::cinder was deprecated
in Kilo release[1], so we can remove it now.
Also, glance::backend::multistore::cinder doesn't have os_region_name,
so it should be removed from its description.

[1] I075224acb9da2bb547d437b08cf6fccfed655d5c
Change-Id: I32a88f9d82dd24ed3592f8647cbb43e9e3c380dd

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-20 16:38:40.000000000', 'message': 'Add negative mulitattach volume swap test

The introduction of [1] blocks attempting to swap a volume that is
currently attached to multiple instances. Repurposing the original
test_volume_swap_with_multiattach test, to be a negative test instead.
Validate a BadRequest is raised when a swap is attempted.

Change-Id: I931a810901cf7847a8259e44a30b0150aad859f2
'}, {'created': '2019-12-20 16:40:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add negative mulitattach volume swap test

The introduction of [1] blocks attempting to swap a volume that is
currently attached to multiple instances. Repurposing the original
test_volume_swap_with_multiattach test, to be a negative test instead.
Validate a BadRequest is raised when a swap is attempted.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662340/

Change-Id: I931a810901cf7847a8259e44a30b0150aad859f2
'}, {'created': '2020-01-08 19:50:15.000000000', 'message': 'compute: Add negative volume update multiattach test

The introduction of Icd7fcb87a09c35a13e4e14235feb30a289d22778 blocks
attempting to update or swap a volume that is currently attached to
multiple instances. This change adds a simple test to assert that a
BadRequest is raised when this is attempted directly against the compute
API.

Future work will also cover this failure when part of a wider volume
retype or migration flow.

Change-Id: I931a810901cf7847a8259e44a30b0150aad859f2

commit_message:
compute: Add negative volume update multiattach test

The introduction of Icd7fcb87a09c35a13e4e14235feb30a289d22778 blocks
attempting to update or swap a volume that is currently attached to
multiple instances. This change adds a simple test to assert that a
BadRequest is raised when this is attempted directly against the compute
API.

Future work will also cover this failure when part of a wider volume
retype or migration flow.

Change-Id: I931a810901cf7847a8259e44a30b0150aad859f2

commit_message:
Mark TestVirtualPorts tests as unstable

Based on debug performed in [1] the TestVirtualPorts
are unstable. At lease one of tests per 20
retries of functional job fail in various
places.
We don't think it is worth to spend more
time on debugging those tests, because there is
a possible easier solution: set virtual port
type based on DEVICE_TYPE, and do not rely
on allowed address pairs.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712888/

(cherry-picked from neutron Iffef8ceb9ca458820a7b3e604a53281f7e93b810)

Change-Id: I1d576c94815de3b8f07c64936006477d1938d88c
Related-Bug: #1865453
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Legacy volume not found

The equals check is too stringent for legacy pre Pike volumes
after an upgrade.  Pre PIke is SMI-S, Pike and later is REST
and identifier name is persisted differently.

Change-Id: I963ad219c2e3b1c9c5edaa8f7e0d3dea911ecd8e
Closes-Bug: #1867163
(cherry picked from commit 4296ea130e1055d608b11b44cbff21358804ae7d)
(cherry picked from commit b2d61850b0826ec258e8c645ac6c8a9bb71a3966)

commit_message:
Add ansible stable-2.9 job and run 2.8 and 2.9

We need to run master of openstacksdk against the stable ansible
branches that have openstack modules.

This partially reverts commit 666381d6e45db8df707ff39a7ef8385cca172c3a.

We no longer are running jobs against devel of ansible, so we don't
need to do the failure job.

Change-Id: Ic783cfd564001a0bd00182725d26928ae6422c3f

commit_message:
Don't reschedule hosts unless we need to

Only reschedule gateways/update segments when things have changed
that would require those actions.

Co-Authored-By: Terry Wilson <twilson@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I62f53dbd862c0f38af4a1434d453e97c18777eb4
Closes-bug: #1861510
Closes-bug: #1861509

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-07 14:37:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Tempest installtion on system wide for stable branch

INSTALL_TEMPEST flag enable to install Tempest by default on
devstack env which is meant for using on master gate only and has
to be false for stable branch. On stable branch master Tempest
on system wide can fail to install for various reason like constraint
etc. That is why we install Tempest on venv always.

This started failing tempest-full on stein gate[1] where
devstack try to install Tempest on system wide also which try to
use py2 env because jobs is py2 and fail.
- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/f05569c475f44327bff7b7ec58faef8c/log/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt#30654

We need to set INSTALL_TEMPEST flag to false on all stable branch to
avoid such issue which we did not do since pike.
(I will make note of this in Devstack branch cut TODO list)
- https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/6067e41a5cc44164e34faab2fd9741dbb788f42f/lib/tempest#L60

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/f05569c475f44327bff7b7ec58faef8c

Change-Id: I60949fb735c82959fb2cfcb6aeef9e33fb0445b6
Closes-Bug: #1871327
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Tempest installtion on system wide for stable branch

INSTALL_TEMPEST flag enable to install Tempest by default on
devstack env which is meant for using on master gate only and has
to be false for stable branch. On stable branch master Tempest
on system wide can fail to install for various reason like constraint
etc. That is why we install Tempest on venv always.

This started failing tempest-full on stein gate[1] where
devstack try to install Tempest on system wide also which try to
use py2 env because jobs is py2 and fail.
- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/f05569c475f44327bff7b7ec58faef8c/log/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt#30654

We need to set INSTALL_TEMPEST flag to false on all stable branch to
avoid such issue which we did not do since pike.
(I will make note of this in Devstack branch cut TODO list)
- https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/6067e41a5cc44164e34faab2fd9741dbb788f42f/lib/tempest#L60

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/f05569c475f44327bff7b7ec58faef8c

Change-Id: I60949fb735c82959fb2cfcb6aeef9e33fb0445b6
Closes-Bug: #1871327

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-28 11:17:36.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] SRIOV with native OVN DHCP server

In order to make SRIOV work for the OVN driver the concept of "external"
ports has been introduced (see depends-on). These ports lives on a
different host (gateway nodes) and are able to reply to arp requests
on behalf of VM port. In the SRIOV case, the SRIOV port is bypassed in
the hypervidor so the OVN driver creates an external port it which will
reply to the DHCP packets.

This patch is creating two new roles to work with the mechanism
described above:

* ControllerSriov: Same as the normal Controller role but with the OVN
Metadata agent deployed.

* NetworkerSriov: Same as the normal Networker role but with the OVN
Metadata agent deployed.

The patch also removes the Neutron DHCP agent from the
neutron-ovn-sriov.yaml environment file since no longer needed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/703376
Change-Id: I5ef3d6543785b677ea333803aaa23bd34abdd671
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[OVN] SRIOV with native OVN DHCP server

In order to make SRIOV work for the OVN driver the concept of "external"
ports has been introduced (see depends-on). These ports lives on a
different host (gateway nodes) and are able to reply to arp requests
on behalf of VM port. In the SRIOV case, the SRIOV port is bypassed in
the hypervidor so the OVN driver creates an external port it which will
reply to the DHCP packets.

This patch is creating two new roles to work with the mechanism
described above:

* ControllerSriov: Same as the normal Controller role but with the OVN
Metadata agent deployed.

* NetworkerSriov: Same as the normal Networker role but with the OVN
Metadata agent deployed.

The patch also removes the Neutron DHCP agent from the
neutron-ovn-sriov.yaml environment file since no longer needed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/703376
Change-Id: I5ef3d6543785b677ea333803aaa23bd34abdd671
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
  * Some other sections are obsolete
- Update classifiers

Change-Id: Ie5f18cce73ca0c2b243e770f6a3c6e78893b1e75
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
  * Some other sections are obsolete
- Update classifiers

Change-Id: Ie5f18cce73ca0c2b243e770f6a3c6e78893b1e75

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-02 01:23:40.000000000', 'message': '[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Only update required is in tox to define common baspython as py3 os that
all tox env including [testenv:functional] will use py3 instead of py2.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ia3e104d62a3b2322407b6290a54f6c93672f9ae1
'}]
commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Only update required is in tox to define common baspython as py3 os that
all tox env including [testenv:functional] will use py3 instead of py2.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ia3e104d62a3b2322407b6290a54f6c93672f9ae1

commit_message:
Retire openstack-ansible-repo_build role

As repo_build role has been succesfully replaced with
python_venv_build role, we have no need in it's futher maintaining and
releasing.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/717715
Change-Id: Iaf1d6da8192afbbd18c64e2b58d54fa5804fe43c

[{'created': '2020-03-24 15:45:02.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Add IGMP snooping support

This patch is ading IGMP snooping support in the OVN driver. Multicast
support has been introduced in core OVN upstream.

Also, the patch always sets the "mcast_flood_unregistered" config in
the OVN Logical_Switch to the same value as the "mcast_snoop" config.
This is so that OVN matches the OVS behavior which is to enable IGMP
flooding by default [0] (in OVN, by default it's false).

commit_message:
[OVN] Add IGMP snooping support

This patch is ading IGMP snooping support in the OVN driver. Multicast
support has been introduced in core OVN upstream.

Also, the patch always sets the "mcast_flood_unregistered" config in
the OVN Logical_Switch to the same value as the "mcast_snoop" config.
This is so that OVN matches the OVS behavior which is to enable IGMP
flooding by default [0] (in OVN, by default it's false).

[0] http://www.openvswitch.org/support/dist-docs/ovs-vsctl.8.txt (grep
for "mcast-snooping-disable")

(cherry-picked from neutron I32f61ba3dd06d7eacf76a74c5c44e1286f90e584)

Change-Id: I132159dbdad95be9f4a0b92e553d78eda5654236
Co-Authored-By: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Correct server topology policy check_str

server topology API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1]
but API is allowed (which is expected) for everyone.

This is because API does not pass the project_id in policy
target so that oslo policy can decide the ownership[2]. If no
target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which
is nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone try to access)
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

Passing the server project_id as target to make it admin_or_owner.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e4ac401d1a9d5fba24bc22141b362a5400d9d096/nova/policies/server_topology.py#L24
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e4ac401d1a9d5fba24bc22141b362a5400d9d096/nova/api/openstack/compute/server_topology.py#L30

Change-Id: I3296e08f16adf95949822bc43c03ef42fed74a4a
Closes-bug: #1870872

commit_message:
Sensu: Remove ceph and process-checks plugins from client

The sensu image became unbuildable, failing to install the ceph plugin:

    Unable to resolve dependencies: sensu-plugins-ceph requires english (= 0.6.3)

This has happened because the author of the 'english' gem has seen fit
to publish a new 0.7.0 release, and 'yank' [1] all previous releases
from rubygems.

This change removes the ceph and process-checks plugins, which both
suffer from a dependency on the yanked english 0.6.3.

[1] https://rubygems.org/gems/english/versions/0.6.3

Change-Id: I9d34413fa10b5a2920aca60b08141bfaddcc7415
Closes-Bug: #1871600

commit_message:
Unbreak mock-releated autospec issue

For some reason, in stable/stein and older, the autospec=True in
this test started failing. Using python3's unittest.mock works, so
just to get this working use that if it exists.

Also adding basepython to python2 via tox.ini to keep pep8 working
in stable/queens.

Change-Id: I508bc07754f11165fb50f5f3f412f6191d27f8b4
Closes-bug: #1867634

commit_message:
Revert "Allow disabling the octavia provider"

This patch confuses the Octavia driver agent process, used my many third party Octavia provider drivers, including but not limited to the OVN provider driver.
The Octavia driver agent should never be shutdown/disabled.

This needs to be split up. It is perfectly valid to enable/disable the OVN provider driver. The driver agent however should not be tied to one third party driver. Shutting it down may break other vendors drivers.

This reverts commit cbec6b3c290b801f11d45f1fe1130e3d952b9d6d.

Change-Id: I9c606ba7acfa79d4707250800d9122d7923bfb4c

commit_message:
Revert "Allow disabling the ovn provider"

This patch confuses the Octavia driver agent process, used my many third party Octavia provider drivers, including but not limited to the OVN provider driver.
The Octavia driver agent should never be shutdown/disabled.

This needs to be split up. It is perfectly valid to enable/disable the OVN provider driver. The driver agent however should not be tied to one third party driver. Shutting it down may break other vendors drivers.

This reverts commit 160e85e51b889f05868adabd4ad1563dab4ba281.

Change-Id: Ibd500f1206f8b02a69ebad199da9e8cf48907fbf

commit_message:
Move pep8 requirements in to test-requirements

We had these in tox.ini before to streamline pep8 (it didn't need
to actually install openstacksdk) But now that we're doing local
hacking checks, we have to install the code, which means this
optimization is bong. Put things back in test-requirements like
sane people. While doing that, remove readme, which isn't in
openstack/requirements and just let doc8 check it.

Conflicts:
	tox.ini

Change-Id: Id1860a1df33610ad7072c13ef9ee61395b785b94
(cherry picked from commit 8748f4a4f8c92e117f37f280c3d8549ca6f6661d)

commit_message:
Enforce constraints for docs dependencies

Tox targets for docs jobs were missing the upper constraints
enforcement. This adds constrained dependency installation for these
targets.

Change-Id: I187cfced08ec8dde561b947e797807dbbf723fe6
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix ovs fw driver for the other ovs agent

In [1] only neutron-openvswitch-agent was fixed and not xenapi.
That merged in Ussuri and went cleanly into Train.
In Stein and Rocky, the backport was not clean and
accidentally fixed xenapi instead of the regular one.

Neither the original bug nor its incomplete fix were released,
except for Rocky. :-(
Hence this patch also removes the confusing reno instead of
adding a new one in Stein+ and adds a new one in Rocky.

Adapted for Rocky regarding reno.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/713129

Change-Id: I331417c8d61ba6f180bcafa943be697418326645
Closes-bug: #1869832
Related-bug: #1867506
(cherry picked from commit c033ddca082618062bdd3abe4b4e7ed111063cbd)

commit_message:
Use constraints for docs installs

Current docs target is not using upper-constraints. This adds
constraints enforcement to the dependency installation.

Change-Id: Ibb36389563eee09e278066da99a76694216ade7e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit a7da00d7e4d0810aafd33839db1441d5f78aea15)

commit_message:
Enforces unicode decoding of data

The underlying APIs changed between Python2 and Python3, where
once they returned a string, they now return bytes. This change
enforces the decoding of the returned value as a UTF-8. Failure
to decode is handled by the existing exception handling.

Tests were updated to mimic the new API.

Change-Id: I98b474840a163f60e98aed0f75bc6b9df2a9aa00
Story: 2003343
Task: 24381
(cherry picked from commit 837a40e3b7358b8ebf6a27de1bd9d904d98bb451)

commit_message:
Tell reno to ignore the kilo branch

When reno 3.x runs under setuptools, it scans all of the branches it can
find, including any that look like they're closed and have an -eol tag.

This patch is a copy of one similar in cinder repo:
https://review.opendev.org/707495

Change-Id: I50a50f75a1e70ccc183f598099f0e2f0fff8985a

commit_message:
Add missing README.rst in elements

Currently dib-lint ensures all elements have README.rst[1], and this
casuses failure in pep8 job because some elements doesn't have
README.rst.
This patch adds missing README.rst to fix pep8 failures to unblock
gate.

[1] Ia5252ddd89b5ae5c6e9a12a66ef10f912fd54da5

Change-Id: I0602de2323aedd5d3334d9a06fe23a3ef5daf4b7

commit_message:
flake8: Ensure local check in hacking 2.0.0

local-check-factory support was dropped in hacking 2.0.0.
The release notes of hacking 2.0.0 [1] suggests to use flake8's
native local plugin support [2]. This commit follows it.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/hacking/unreleased.html#relnotes-2-0-0
[2] https://flake8.pycqa.org/en/3.7.0/user/configuration.html#using-local-plugins

Change-Id: I3215b19684032a4642f1d4741b14843572c30222

commit_message:
flake8: Ensure local check in hacking 2.0.0

local-check-factory support was dropped in hacking 2.0.0.
The release notes of hacking 2.0.0 [1] suggests to use flake8's
native local plugin support [2]. This commit follows it.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/hacking/unreleased.html#relnotes-2-0-0
[2] https://flake8.pycqa.org/en/3.7.0/user/configuration.html#using-local-plugins

Change-Id: I2a0648eabe1e6e46da8c81e8906d7b6731465f53

commit_message:
Prepare for relase using OpenStack release process

README is also updated to satisfy what PyPI expects.
This is required to pass the validation in openstack/releases repo.

Note that the latest version has not published to PyPI
and there is no need to bump xstatic version.

commit_message:
Prepare for relase using OpenStack release process

README is also updated to satisfy what PyPI expects.
This is required to pass the validation in openstack/releases repo.

Note that the latest version has not published to PyPI
and there is no need to bump xstatic version.

Change-Id: If54a45086704784a4e71b545be0b51b460729bb8

[{'created': '2020-03-19 18:42:15.000000000', 'message': 'Make octavia provider drivers overridable

This patch adds support to override the default behavior for configuring
the provider drivers and enabling the driver agent. This allows for
amphora only deployments, ovn only deployments, and third party driver
deployments without any of the default provider drivers. The driver
agent can also be disabled if it is not needed

Note: also disables the driver agent for scenario 10 CI because of a
problem with the OVN provider at the moment.

commit_message:
Allow disabling the ovn provider

Initially to be used to work around issues with ovn provider driver
breaking CI this can be used. We may remove this before it is released
as there are alternate mechanisms that might be better.

Change-Id: If04a719052cf650502258450477713d9fe06015a

sent to wrong branch by mistake'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2020-03-25 14:45:33.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-03-25 14:45:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-03-27 21:35:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-03-30 14:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-04-01 13:30:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2020-04-01 13:34:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2020-04-01 13:35:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-04-08 15:37:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

So there are a couple of issues with this patch. It's tempting for a revert.
1. The driver agent is used by multiple third party Octavia provider drivers (there are 5), not just the OVN driver.
2. It was the OVN provider driver that broke CI, not the Octavia provider driver.
3. If you disable the driver agent, you may disable/break any of the five third party drivers, F5, A10, VMware, Radware, etc. and not just the OVN driver.
So, this patch should have been split.
The Octavia driver agent process should always be installed with Octavia, not matter what.
The second patch should have been to enabled/disable a specific third provider driver, the OVN driver in this case."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-04-08 15:44:53.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I9c606ba7acfa79d4707250800d9122d7923bfb4c'}]

commit_message:
Allow disabling the octavia provider

To be used to work around issues with octavia provider driver
breaking CI. By default, the octavia provider is enabled, and
this change adds the ability to disable it by setting the
following attribute:

OctaviaEnableDriverAgent: false

This is a partial backport of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/713960/
It is partial because it does not disable octavia provider driver
for any CI tests (such as scenario010-standalone.yaml)

Change-Id: If04a719052cf650502258450477713d9fe06015a
(cherry picked from commit 160e85e51b889f05868adabd4ad1563dab4ba281)

commit_message:
container_puppet_config: don't show a warning if config_hash is empty

Default the old config hash to an empty string, so during step1 when
creating puppet & startup configs there is no need to display empty
config hashes.

Change-Id: I417aea66ad0dc0a868eaadda1e6eacc847389f16
(cherry picked from commit 00e71a890f20774c14faa5687c789715c29f6272)

subject: tripleo_container_rm: fix check mode
messages: [{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-08 00:22:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-04-08 12:36:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-08 00:22:32.000000000', 'message': "tripleo_container_rm: fix check mode

If tripleo_container_rm is run in check mode, the task which detect what
container cli is used will be skipped and the next task relying on the
register will fail to run.

Let's force the first tasks to be run so we know which container cli is
used; and keep running the rest of the playbooks in check mode.

Change-Id: I4c5f92b7f308d655c5c94c62c694ad1cea08d625
(cherry picked from commit ee81ecb240a065eec55d8379580cf63b51f68238)
"}]
commit_message:
tripleo_container_rm: fix check mode

If tripleo_container_rm is run in check mode, the task which detect what
container cli is used will be skipped and the next task relying on the
register will fail to run.

Let's force the first tasks to be run so we know which container cli is
used; and keep running the rest of the playbooks in check mode.

Change-Id: I4c5f92b7f308d655c5c94c62c694ad1cea08d625
(cherry picked from commit ee81ecb240a065eec55d8379580cf63b51f68238)

subject: Relax get_failed_containers() filter
messages: [{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-08 00:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-04-08 12:36:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-08 00:21:46.000000000', 'message': "Relax get_failed_containers() filter

When Ansible is run in check mode, the async_results are missing some
keys from regular runs, so we can't really tell if the container has
finished and failed; let's just skip it.

Closes-Bug: #1871397
Change-Id: I5f99c8e5392326fc8274ca3278966cddd49e0c3d
(cherry picked from commit bc25dd663e482bc9608b2251f319daa0a32f7e87)
"}]
commit_message:
Relax get_failed_containers() filter

When Ansible is run in check mode, the async_results are missing some
keys from regular runs, so we can't really tell if the container has
finished and failed; let's just skip it.

Closes-Bug: #1871397
Change-Id: I5f99c8e5392326fc8274ca3278966cddd49e0c3d
(cherry picked from commit bc25dd663e482bc9608b2251f319daa0a32f7e87)

commit_message:
Use constraints for docs installs

Current docs target is not using upper-constraints. This adds
constraints enforcement to the dependency installation.

Change-Id: Ibb36389563eee09e278066da99a76694216ade7e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-04-07 13:44:39.000000000', 'message': "Drop netaddr - use netutils.is_valid_ipv6()

Change I8c595830b8c7974c651a9e524b57a6540e4f3d1f

for allocating multiple IPv6 addresses fixes provisioning
on DHCPv6-stateful networks.

Change-Id: I976bf9cee6fd10736f9fc88ca816266651b979c6
"}]
commit_message:
Drop netaddr - use netutils.is_valid_ipv6()

Change I8c595830b8c7974c651a9e524b57a6540e4f3d1f
added a dependency on netaddr. Ironic did'nt directly
depend on netaddr prior to this.

This removes the use of netaddr, netutils.is_valid_ipv6()
is used instead.

Also update the releasenote to clarify that the support
for allocating multiple IPv6 addresses fixes provisioning
on DHCPv6-stateful networks.

Story: 2007315
Task: 39321
Change-Id: I976bf9cee6fd10736f9fc88ca816266651b979c6

commit_message:
Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and murano use it in many place[1],
this PS to update the remained json module to oslo jsonutils for
consistency.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/murano/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=jsonutils&type=

Change-Id: Ie8dc01df02b5c160414ab118ff9b4c8e8527053d

[{'created': '2020-02-18 17:00:07.000000000', 'message': 'Update gitreview host name

This fixes the host name for git review. This name gets redirected, but
for release automation that happens after tagging, this could cause
issues because the name does not match what is expected for the ssh key.

Change-Id: Ib9d0aa4108466abfcb9ef7076e2e527e65dea5c7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update gitreview host name

This fixes the host name for git review. This name gets redirected, but
for release automation that happens after tagging, this could cause
issues because the name does not match what is expected for the ssh key.

Change-Id: Ib9d0aa4108466abfcb9ef7076e2e527e65dea5c7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-08 02:57:34.000000000', 'message': 'fix(mariadb): handle empty grastate value

In the scenario where the grastate value cannot be found, we should not
be updating the configmap values. This should also prevent a possible
type incompatibility issue in error scenario.

Change-Id: I0fb08b329a3fb05c65bead5781c84a592ae4c263
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
'}, {'created': '2020-04-08 03:04:36.000000000', 'message': 'fix(mariadb): handle empty grastate value

In the scenario where the grastate value cannot be found, we should not
be updating the configmap values. This should also prevent a possible
type incompatibility issue in error scenario.

Change-Id: I0fb08b329a3fb05c65bead5781c84a592ae4c263
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
'}, {'created': '2020-04-08 03:47:56.000000000', 'message': 'fix(mariadb): handle empty grastate value

In the scenario where the grastate value cannot be found, we should not
be updating the configmap values. This should also prevent a possible
type incompatibility issue in error scenario.

Change-Id: I0fb08b329a3fb05c65bead5781c84a592ae4c263
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
'}, {'created': '2020-04-08 03:55:00.000000000', 'message': "fix(mariadb): handle empty grastate value

In the scenario where grastate values cannot be found, we will set the
configmap to 'None' and log a warning.. This should also prevent a possible
type incompatibility issue in error scenario.

Change-Id: I0fb08b329a3fb05c65bead5781c84a592ae4c263
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
"}]
commit_message:
fix(mariadb): handle empty grastate value

In the scenario where grastate values cannot be found, we will set the
configmap to 'None' and log a warning.. This should also prevent a possible
type incompatibility issue in error scenario.

Change-Id: I0fb08b329a3fb05c65bead5781c84a592ae4c263
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I8aa105b1839abde00815849a79f84ca19c73e583

commit_message:
Add new share replica quotas to the CLI

- Added support to two new quotas for share replicas, being
  `share_replicas` and `replica_gigabytes`.

Depends-On: I8ba7bc6f167c28d6c169b2187d0e1bda7cad3f69
Partially-Implements: bp limit-share-replicas-per-share
Change-Id: I700adc0cb64e03ef66cf7123601a406891d526f2

commit_message:
make scenario001 non-voting until packages are sane

We're having issues getting a promotion after
rsync backup/restore on dlrn pulled in old
invalid packages into promoted yum repos.
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/26294/

Change-Id: I168fb4dded9879607be8364ca28ca1601656ec82

kolla-toolbox container name variable is fixed in some places,
but in the defaults directory, kolla-toolbox container_name variable
is variable. If the kolla-toolbox container_name variable is changed
during deployment, it will not be assigned to kolla-toolbox,
but a fixed 'kolla-toolbox' name.

(cherry picked from commit 8721ca35d8b270c02061070170124d907887805f)

commit_message:
kolla-toolbox container name variable

kolla-toolbox container name variable is fixed in some places,
but in the defaults directory, kolla-toolbox container_name variable
is variable. If the kolla-toolbox container_name variable is changed
during deployment, it will not be assigned to kolla-toolbox,
but a fixed 'kolla-toolbox' name.

Change-Id: I9579017761ff47477dba597282be9ae6fab4242a
(cherry picked from commit 8721ca35d8b270c02061070170124d907887805f)

commit_message:
Create validate command

This patch adds the validate command in the tempest-skip project and
tox-functional jobs since we now have python code.
This will be necessary in order to validate the yaml file, and can also be used in a job.
Also, documentation update and added new packages in the requirements.

Change-Id: I38b9b98d66c50b2da98e316f856f210ea0d99fd1

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Update some URLs to latest
3. Remove unncessary "=="

Change-Id: Ie2cb66a5d803186034055ccb7ca165b13d69ec54

commit_message:
Prometheus: Elasticsearch Alerts Scalar/Vector Conversion

This change updates the prometheus alerting rules to use ranged vectors
in their expressions, to avoid situations wher missed scrapes would
cause scalar metrics to "go stale" - resetting the alert timer.

Only the elasticsearch alerts are affected by this change.

Change-Id: I439877de841754e70020c280b552f3cab5a46096
Co-Authored-By: Meghan Heisler <mkheisler93@gmail.com>

This looks good to me, but I do have concerns about the steps that need to be in place prior to creating a stable branch, and how we should handle that to avoid issues if we are not actually ready.

As it is right now, we need the following to happen before we can create a new stable branch with this in place:

1) Next release named
2) Releases repo updated with the schedule for the next series so series_status has the next series information
3) TC approved official platforms, so that we have:
4) Supported python runtimes defined
5) Job definitions added for those supported runtimes for the next series name

These are not all in place yet, so if we were to merge this right now, we have branching requests that would cause issues.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-04 14:57:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add tooling to update python jobs on branch creation

Currently, we need to update jobs manually after a branch is
created.

When a project is branched, the master branch should then
be pointing to the new named python3 tests.

This should do it.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-07 14:36:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Tempest installtion on system wide for stable branch

INSTALL_TEMPEST flag enable to install Tempest by default on
devstack env which is meant for using on master gate only and has
to be false for stable branch. On stable branch master Tempest
on system wide can fail to install for various reason like constraint
etc. That is why we install Tempest on venv always.

This started failing tempest-full on stein gate[1] where
devstack try to install Tempest on system wide also which try to
use py2 env because jobs is py2 and fail.
- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/f05569c475f44327bff7b7ec58faef8c/log/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt#30654

We need to set INSTALL_TEMPEST flag to false on all stable branch to
avoid such issue which we did not do since pike.
(I will make note of this in Devstack branch cut TODO list)
- https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/6067e41a5cc44164e34faab2fd9741dbb788f42f/lib/tempest#L60

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/f05569c475f44327bff7b7ec58faef8c

Change-Id: I60949fb735c82959fb2cfcb6aeef9e33fb0445b6
Closes-Bug: #1871327
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Tempest installtion on system wide for stable branch

INSTALL_TEMPEST flag enable to install Tempest by default on
devstack env which is meant for using on master gate only and has
to be false for stable branch. On stable branch master Tempest
on system wide can fail to install for various reason like constraint
etc. That is why we install Tempest on venv always.

This started failing tempest-full on stein gate[1] where
devstack try to install Tempest on system wide also which try to
use py2 env because jobs is py2 and fail.
- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/f05569c475f44327bff7b7ec58faef8c/log/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt#30654

We need to set INSTALL_TEMPEST flag to false on all stable branch to
avoid such issue which we did not do since pike.
(I will make note of this in Devstack branch cut TODO list)
- https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/6067e41a5cc44164e34faab2fd9741dbb788f42f/lib/tempest#L60

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/f05569c475f44327bff7b7ec58faef8c

Change-Id: I60949fb735c82959fb2cfcb6aeef9e33fb0445b6
Closes-Bug: #1871327

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-04 06:37:36.000000000', 'message': 'Run ifup on a bond when a slave interface is restarted

This change adds the bond to the list of interfaces to be
restarted when a slave interface is restarted. On Fedora/CentOS
like systems restart all interface slaves in a bond, the bond
will be left in a downed state. This change runs ifup on the
bond if any slave interfaces are restarted, which insures that
the bond should be up in all cases when os-net-config exits.

Change-Id: Ibbe8021afdc4772c6e2017d11d012b8f5c46d907
Closes-bug: 1870608
'}, {'created': '2020-04-04 15:26:39.000000000', 'message': 'Run ifup on a bond when a slave interface is restarted

restarted when a slave interface is restarted. On Fedora/CentOS
like systems restart all interface slaves in a bond, the bond
will be left in a downed state. This change runs ifup on the
bond if any slave interfaces are restarted, which insures that
the bond should be up in all cases when os-net-config exits.

Change-Id: Ibbe8021afdc4772c6e2017d11d012b8f5c46d907
Closes-bug: 1870608
'}, {'created': '2020-04-04 15:36:36.000000000', 'message': 'Run ifup on a bond when a slave interface is restarted

This change adds the bond to the list of interfaces to be
restarted when a slave interface is restarted. On Fedora/CentOS
like systems restart all interface slaves in a bond, the bond
will be left in a downed state. This change runs ifup on the
bond if any slave interfaces are restarted, which insures that
the bond should be up in all cases when os-net-config exits.
Tests were added to ensure that in all cases each interface
or bond will only be restarted once, and that bonds will only
be restarted if the interface modifications require restart.

Change-Id: Ibbe8021afdc4772c6e2017d11d012b8f5c46d907
Closes-bug: 1870608
'}, {'created': '2020-04-06 21:49:40.000000000', 'message': 'Run ifup on a bond when a slave interface is restarted

restarted when a slave interface is restarted. On Fedora/CentOS
like systems restart all interface slaves in a bond, the bond
will be left in a downed state. This change runs ifup on the
bond if any slave interfaces are restarted, which insures that
the bond should be up in all cases when os-net-config exits.
Tests were added to ensure that in all cases each interface
or bond will only be restarted once, and that bonds will only
be restarted if the interface modifications require restart.

Change-Id: Ibbe8021afdc4772c6e2017d11d012b8f5c46d907
Closes-bug: 1870608

commit_message:
Run ifup on a bond when a slave interface is restarted

This change adds the bond to the list of interfaces to be
restarted when a slave interface is restarted. On Fedora/CentOS
like systems restart all interface slaves in a bond, the bond
will be left in a downed state. This change runs ifup on the
bond if any slave interfaces are restarted, which insures that
the bond should be up in all cases when os-net-config exits.
Tests were added to ensure that in all cases each interface
or bond will only be restarted once, and that bonds will only
be restarted if the interface modifications require restart.

Change-Id: Ibbe8021afdc4772c6e2017d11d012b8f5c46d907
Closes-bug: 1870608

commit_message:
Release final python-vitrageclient for ussuri

Final ussuri client lib release for the April 9 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: I1af074f85f1eff35cdf46a707568b39bc620f86a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix multiple CI failures

1. Install python-openstackclient using upper constraints

Detect current branch from .gitreview and use upper constraints to
install python-openstackclient, to guarantee compatibility with the
Python version in use.

(cherry picked from commit ef33e6ecb770f852bb4433d6b0d2dec7778937a4)

2. Use tenks stable/1.0 for Python 2 support

Tenks dropped Python 2 compatibility in its master branch.

Change-Id: Ie44508fe3d3b08190afa5a43748e43548a63ff82
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/717208

commit_message:
OOO Validations command changed in OpenStack Train

In OpenStack Train, the way to run validations changed from Mistral
workflows to a dedicated command "openstack tripleo validator"

Run the validations one way or the other depending on the "release"
variable.

commit_message:
Maintain OSD state on upgrade

Sync charms.ceph

Ensure each OSD reaches its pre-restart state before proceeding
after restart. This prevents the charm from finalizing the upgrade
prior to OSDs recovering after upgrade. For example, if the state
is 'active' prior to restart, then it must reach 'active' after
restart, at which point the upgrade will be allowed to complete.

Change-Id: I1067a8cdd1e2b706db07f194eca6fb2efeccb817
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/713743/
Closes-Bug: #1821028
(cherry picked from commit cb0f757f185565bcec1179087be037d596e9885a)

commit_message:
Update series metadata

Ensure that EOL releases are removed from metadata
and tests, and that the current dev release is enabled
in metadata.  Dev release tests are enabled separately
because of chickens and eggs.

Change-Id: Ica86e702ea71d2bbe375dab37c86f069a6dc0721

[{'created': '2019-12-13 14:47:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix: failed to create snapshot with DriverFilter

Previously, while creating snapshots, the code didn't pass through
scheduler therefore available capacity for backend wasn't checked.
This was supported by [1] which passed a RequestSpec object to
scheduler with snapshot and volume properties (the same RequestSpec
object is used for volumes).
But when the scheduler tries to get volume_type from RequestSpec obj,
unfortunately, it has a property named 'volume_type' but is None for
snapshots which breaks the scheduler when getting extra_specs from
the volume type (as the default value {} would've been set if the
property didn't exist).

Similar issue occurred when we supported untyped volumes and was
fixed by [2] and [3].

This patch sets the volume_type to an empty dict when it is found
None (which is the case while creating snapshots).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/509011/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/457431/
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/471672/

Change-Id: I89a8cc42ca8984ee837a2b88f60ad126783282b9
Closes-Bug: #1856126

commit_message:
Fix: failed to create snapshot with DriverFilter

Previously, while creating snapshots, the code didn't pass through
scheduler therefore available capacity for backend wasn't checked.
This was supported by [1] which passed a RequestSpec object to
scheduler with snapshot and volume properties (the same RequestSpec
object is used for volumes).
But when the scheduler tries to get volume_type from RequestSpec obj,
unfortunately, it has a property named 'volume_type' but is None for
snapshots which breaks the scheduler when getting extra_specs from
the volume type (as the default value {} would've been set if the
property didn't exist).

Similar issue occurred when we supported untyped volumes and was
fixed by [2] and [3].

This patch sets the volume_type to an empty dict when it is found
None (which is the case while creating snapshots).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/509011/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/457431/
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/471672/

Change-Id: I89a8cc42ca8984ee837a2b88f60ad126783282b9
Closes-Bug: #1856126

commit_message:
Enable focal and ussuri as part of the gate tests

Add bionic-ussuri and focal-ussuri (with mysql8 support) bundles.

Also, for focal, switch the install and upgrade-charm hooks to install
python3 modules rather than python2 modules.

Change-Id: I75dbf72eb4c2d7d2986730e0ada9a6c359f825d3

commit_message:
mariadb container name variable

mariadb container name variable is fixed in some places,
but in the defaults directory, mariadb container_name variable
is variable. If the mariadb container_name variable is changed
during deployment, it will not be assigned to container_name,
but a fixed 'mariadb' name.

Change-Id: Ie8efa509953d5efa5c3073c9b550be051a7f4f9b
(cherry picked from commit 8a206699d4d2e550963a7b7be38fc8281075133c)
